loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Tsitsi from Harare, a widow with four children.  Tsitsi runs a manufacturing business making furniture. The business has been in operation for the past 19 years. She says the main challenges she faces are delayed payments from clients, as she sometimes gives credit to her clients or sell on a deposit payment basis.  

Tsitsi has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy boards, timber and glue. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her improve the standard of living for her family.  In the future, Tsitsi plans to own a showroom.

loans.use: to buy furniture-making materials

loans.name: Bana Baluna Group

texts.en:
This is 23-year-old Tryone from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe.  Tryone is single and has no children but he is taking care for his two younger brothers. 

Tryone runs a construction  supply business selling cement, pit sand and bricks. The business has been in operation for 3 years. He says the rainy season is the most difficult time for his business as construction levels off. 

Tryone has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy cement and pit sand for brick moulding. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to send his brothers to school and buy food and uniforms. In the future, Tryone plans to be the biggest supplier of building materials to the large companies.

loans.use: to buy cement and pit sand to make bricks

loans.name: Devine Springs Group

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mollen from Machipisa, Harare. She is single and has two children, both are attending school.  Mollen runs a manufacturing business tailoring clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges she faces are power disruptions. 

Mollen has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy fabrics. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. In the future, Mollen plans to be the market leader in supplying clothing to her community.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (two sisters).  

Milly  has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week.  Milly sells her products from home by means of retail.   She also generates additional income through poultry farming.  The main business challenges for Milly include transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease on transportation.

Milly has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.   

Milly lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Terimbere Muhinzi Zone 3 Group

texts.fr:
Fidele  fait partie du groupe Terimberemuhinzi Zone 3. Il a 43 ans et il est marié avec 8 enfants de 2 à 18 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Fidele est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture. Dans les prochaines années, Fidele voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fidele is a member of the Terimberemuhinzi Zone 3 group. He is 43 years old and is married with 8 children ranging in age from 2 to 18, six of whom are in school. He has six years of primary education.

Fidele grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer.

His strategy for increasing the size of his business is to enlarge his cultivation area. In the coming years, he would like to be the rice provider in his region. With his profits, he plans on making sure his children receive an education..

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and six children. Two of her children are still attending school and four are  working.  

Amina cooperates with her husband to be able to fulfill her family's needs.  She has owned a vegetables shop for thirteen years. As for her husband, he has been transporting students in his own van for the past ten years. 

Today, Amina is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate her shop and purchase more vegetables in order to attract more customers and augment her sales. In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop to include exotic fruits.

loans.use: renovate her shop and purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is a young entrepreneur from Lanjazat village.  She runs a hairdressing salon. Armine started her business a few months ago and during this period has attracted a large number of clients due to the quality of her services. 

Armine needs to add new equipment to her salon in order to serve all her clients. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase new hairdressing equipment. This loan will allow Armine to increase her income and develop the business further.

loans.use: buy hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, blankets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, buckets, blankets, shoes

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children, who are still attending school.  He is the main source of income for his family and works really hard to provide a better future for his young children. 

Nidal started his own metal work in 1990 and is looking forward to growing his business. Today, he wants to borrow $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a laser machine and additional metal equipment.  He notes that this Kiva loan will increase his profits by 20%. In the future, he plans to expand his business by buying extra technological tools.

loans.use: buy a laser machine and metal equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Abeie

texts.en:
Abeie is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. All three of them are in school. For two years, she has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan.
Abeie requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions, oil, and sugar for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase oil, onions, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two  nephews).

Teopista has a business of a pub.  She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days a week.  Teopista sells her products from home, by means of retail.   Teopista has requested  for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerry cans of local gin. She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Teopista include transportating jerycans of local Gin and crates of beef and Soda from the market to her home, and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation and  also to build more rental rooms. Teopista lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Majid

texts.en: Majid, who lives in Nor Dvin village together with his wife, children and grandchildren, has been successfully managing his cattle business for 25 years.  With the help of this loan, Majid will be able to increase both his number of cattle and his income which, in turn, will improve his family's living conditions and insure a stable future for them.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

loans.name: Vumilia Group

texts.en:
Everline is the facilitator of the Vumilia group. Everline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Everline takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for her family and to have much technology in production. In the recent 2011 season, Everline had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Everline was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Everline will educate her children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Vumilia group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Everline with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks, stock feeds, and medicine.

loans.name: Dubai Group

texts.en:
Mercy is a widow with 4 children - 2 boys and 2 girls. They are all working. For the past 15 years, Mercy has run her own chicken selling business. She works from 6am to 6pm each day and makes a very good monthly profit. 

This will be her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Her previous four loans were all repaid in full and on-time. This loan will be used to purchase more chickens for her business. Mercy dreams of selling chickens wholesale to various hotels. 

Mercy will share this loan with the Dubai group. Dubai has 15 group members and Mercy acts as the Chairperson. Each member holds the others accountable for repaying their share of this loan.

loans.use: to be a wholesale on chicken business

loans.name: Ayom

texts.en: Ayom, a 30-year-old married woman with two children, two of whom are in school, has operated a business selling milk in Bor South Sudan for two years. Ayom is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase milk, and plans to use the resulting extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fresh milk for sale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She has operated a grocery stall for the last two years, a business she set up from her savings.

Joyce learned of Milango from her friends and is now applying for a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase dry fish, potatoes, greens, and tomatoes. The main business challenge she faces is inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. Her ambition is to open a cereals wholesale shop. She will use the extra income to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish, potatoes, greens, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stationery.

loans.name: Beeda

texts.en:
Beeda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with seven children and  only one child goes to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

She sells green bananas. She has been in business for one year. She sells her products on a retail basis at the market. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth forma parte del Banco comunal “Ilusión 2011” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva para niños y adultos, desde hace dos años. Su mercadería la compra cada dos meses en el barrio Meiggs ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Comenta que comenzó con el negocio cuando se jubiló de su trabajo dependiente, en ese momento se percató que debía seguir manteniendo sus ingresos. 
La modalidad de sus ventas las realiza desde su hogar, los clientes solicitan productos y ella se encarga de comprar la mercadería. Además cuenta con un gran número de clientes, quienes prefieren su modalidad de trabajo. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa de temporada, específicamente jeans y poleras.
Las metas en su negocio son tener buenas utilidades para comprarse un vehículo, que le permita trasladar su mercadería. 
Ruth vive junto a su madre y su hermana. Uno de sus sueños son obtener su casa propia, para esto ya postuló al subsidio habitacional, por lo que ahora se encuentra a la espera del llamado para que comiencen a construir. 
Las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que debe costear los gastos de la casa y para solventarse ella también.
Ruth comenta que desde hace tres años debe cuidar a su madre quien debe recibir cuidados especiales, ya que se encuentra postrada, por lo que su negocio le permite cierta flexibilidad de horarios para atenderla. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda entregada por Fondo esperanza, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio, lo que le ha permitido tener mejores ingresos y por ende una mejor calidad de vida. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones ella ha aprendido a administrar de mejor manera sus ingresos, lo que le ha permitido organizar la contabilidad de su negocio. Por lo que comenta, la institución ha sido una ayuda integral. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Ruth is part of the “Ilusión 2011” communal bank belonging to the city of Viña del Mar.  She has been selling new clothes for adults and children for two years.  She buys her merchandise every two months in the city of Santiago’s Meiggs neighborhood.  She comments that she started the business when she retired from her salaried job; at that time she noted that she had to continue earning income. Her sales are home-based.  Customers place orders and she then goes out and buys the merchandise.  

She has a large number of customers who like her way of doing business.  She will use the loan to buy seasonal clothes, specifically jeans and t-shirts.  Her business goal is to earn good profits to buy a vehicle that will make it possible for her to transport her merchandise.

Ruth lives with her mother and her sister.  One of her dreams is to have a house of her own and to do so she’s already signed up for a housing subsidy and is waiting for the approval to start building.  Her motivation to stay in business is that she must be able to pay the costs of the house as well as support herself.

Ruth comments that she’s had to care for her mother who is bedridden and needs special care for the last three years.  Her business affords her the flexibility in schedule that she needs to be able to care for her.

She is very happy and grateful for the help Fondo Esperanza has given her because she was able to invest in the business which has led to improved income and thus a better quality of life.

With respect to the training, she’s learned how to better manage her income which has allowed her to organize her business’ bookkeeping so she mentions that the institution has been an integral help.

Viña del Mar is a city and commune located on Chile’s central coast.  It’s knows as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios some of the city’s older homes have.  It is also considered to be Chile’s tourism capital.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Laskmi

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Laskmi; ella tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,ella vende ceramicas,polos,gorras y chalinas,la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania,su sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de artesania.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesania como polos,chompas,gorras y ceramicas al por mayor. 
La socia es una persona muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Laskmi is 34 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. She continues with her business of selling handicrafts. She sells ceramics, polo shirts, caps, and scarves. Laskmi works as a traveling vendor from 8am to 6pm. Through this business, she is able to help her children move forward. Laskmi wants to expand and improve her business of selling handicrafts. She dreams of having a craft store. Laskmi is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts such as polo shirts, sweaters, caps, and ceramics in bulk. She is an enterprising person who has tremendous desire to succeed so that her family can get ahead.

Laskmi is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts to sell in bulk such as polo shirts, sweaters, caps, and ceramics.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school, while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a café business, selling food to her neighbors and passersby. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a restaurant in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Sope Abdou Sarr Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 novembre 2011. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Aissatou (debout à gauche de la photo et habillée en robe violet et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 41 ans. Elle est une mariée et mère d'un  enfant.

Elle développe une petit commerce de légumes. Son nouveau prêt de 50000 francs CFA lui permettra d'acheter des sacs carottes, de choux, des paniers de tomates fraîches qu'elle va revendre au niveau de son quartier.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices Aissatou va renforcer son capital, et subvenir aux différentes charges familiales telles que payer les factures d'électricité et d'eau.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on November 23, 2011. It is composed of 11 women living in the same area. Their main business activity is vending.
Mrs. Aissatou (standing on the left in the photo wearing a violet dress and raising her hand) is the group’s leader. She is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of one child.

Her business is selling vegetables. Her new loan of 50,000 West African francs will allow her to buy some bags of carrots and cabbage as well as baskets of fresh tomatoes, for resale in her neighborhood. Thanks to her income, Aissatou will bolster her capital and  take care of  various family  expenses, such as bills for electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage and carrots for resale

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with ten children. Seven attend school and three have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a goat meat selling business, selling at the market to butcher shop operators in the area. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to cover a large market in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase goats and cattle for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cattle for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy equipment for dry cleaning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals, cooking oil, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Jackelyn Veronica

texts.es:
Jackelyn, se dedica al destazo de cerdos, viene acompañada de su esposo y tiene una niña de un año de edad, ella inició en el negocio por la ayuda que recibió de  su suegra, quien le enseñó el trabajo en la carnicería y hoy en día trabaja en conjunto con su esposo, lleva ya dos años de experiencia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cinco cerdos cada uno por un precio de $100, esto le ayudará para mantener en la granja disponibilidad de animales y destazarlos en el momento necesario. Con las compras espera mejorar y seguir ofreciendo a los clientes costilla y carne de buena calidad.
Su aspiración es tener el negocio más grande, que espera conseguirlo dentro de unos años con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, con ello espera que su familia vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Jackelyn butchers pigs.  She is accompanied by her husband and her one-year-old daughter.  Jackelyn started this business with help she received from her mother-in-law, who taught her the work that takes place in a butcher shop.  Today she works with her husband and already has two years of experience.

Jackelyn is requesting a loan to buy five pigs, each one priced at $100.  This will help maintain the available number of animals she has on hand so that she can butcher them as needed.  With these purchases, she expects to improve and continue offering her customers ribs and meat that are of good quality.  

Her aspiration is to have a larger business.  She hopes to proceed for a few years with great effort and dedication in expectation that her family will live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy five pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, handbags and traveling bags.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 38-year-old a married woman with no children. 

She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Ayen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es:
Isodoro sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Isodoro sigue dedicándose a la venta de ceviche y sigue en su stand en unos de los mercados más populares de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad el socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como pescado, limón, cebolla, maíz entre otros más.

Isodoro está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Isidoro continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Comuzone III” which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. He continues to sell “ceviche” (marinated seafood) from a stand at one of the busiest markets in the city of Cusco. Isidoro is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy supplies such as fish, lemons, onions, corn, and other ingredients.

He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fish, lemons, onions, corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Sope Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 novembre 2011. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui habitement pratiquement ensemble et ont de bonnes relations sociales 

Madame Seynabou (est debout à gauche de la photo habillée en robe noir) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 23 ans. Elle est  mariée et mère d'un enfant.

Elle fait un petit commerce d'habits pour bébé depuis plusieurs années

Avec son nouveau crédit de 50000 francs CFA elle va acheter des ensembles d'habits bébé (garçon comme filles) pour revendre dans le quartier.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices , elle va soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales en en contribuant à l'achetant de riz ,huile ,sucre, lait ,fournitures scolaire et ordonnances pour son enfant en cas de maladie.
texts.en: This solidarity group was created on November 23, 2011. It is composed of twelve women who essentially live together and have good social relations. Madame Seynabou (standing on the left of the photo in a black dress) is the leader of the group.  She is married and is the mother of one child. For several years, she has been running a small shop selling baby clothing. With her new loan of 50,000 CFA francs, she will buy sets of baby clothing (for boys and girls) to sell in her neighborhood. With the help of her profits, she will support her husband in managing family expenses by contributing to the purchase of rice, oil, sugar, milk, school supplies, and prescriptions for their children in case of illness.

loans.use: Purchase baby clothing for retail

loans.name: Milton Manuel

texts.es:
Milton es agricultor, vive con su madre y sus hermanos, es soltero, tiene un hijo, él inició con la agricultura por medio de su padre, no tiene un horario fijo para ejercer las labores agrícolas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, herbicidas, semilla para iniciar la siembra de verano.
Con la inversión del préstamo Milton espera que sus cultivos sean provechosos y tenga una abundante cosecha, para poder proveer su familia el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Milton is a farmer who lives with his mother and siblings. He is single and has one child. Milton got started in farming because of his father. He does not work on a fixed schedule when performing his farming duties.

Milton is currently requesting a loan to buy farming supplies such as compost, herbicides, and seeds so that he can begin planting his summer crop. With this investment, Milton expects to have crops that will result in a profitable and abundant harvest. This will enable him to provide for the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, and seeds.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
Encarnacion sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y él sigue dedicándose a la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo chompas de alpaca. En esta oportunidad la socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como por ejemplo chompas de lana de alpaca.

Encarnacion está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos y él está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Encarnacion continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Comuzone III” which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She continues to sell handicrafts, such as alpaca wool sweaters. Encarnacion is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy merchandise, such as alpaca wool sweaters.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts to sell, such as alpaca wool sweaters.

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, administra una tienda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, el menor de sus hijos estudia en la universidad, tiene 19 años de edad, Reina se dedica a atender clientes en su tienda, donde les ofrece productos de calidad para el uso domestico.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería, jugos, gaseosas, frijoles, arroz, detergentes y jabón, la compra le ayudara para aumentar el inventario y mejorar así la atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de Reina es tener una mejor calidad de vida, darles lo mejor a la familia y ser buen cliente pagando puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Reina manages a store and lives with her husband and two children. Her youngest child, age 19, is studying at the university. Reina attends to the customers in her store where she offers quality products for home use.

She is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise such as juices, sodas, beans, rice, detergents, and soap. This purchase will help increase her inventory and improve service to her customers. Reina aspires to have a better quality of life, provide the best for her family, and be a good client when submitting her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy juices, sodas, beans, rice, detergents, and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries and hardware.

loans.name: Hediye

texts.en:
Hediye is 37 years old, married, and has two children, aged 18 and 14. Hediye has been selling women’s accessories for six months.  

At first she had many broken dreams but she pursued them for a long time and finally overcame the various barriers.  Many people around her were not supportive of her business, but she moved forward and set up a small business.  Since her business is new, she has a small product line. 
 
With this loan from Maya, she would like to buy more materials in order to expand her inventory.  She believes that with a wider variety of inventory, she can increase her customer base and make a better profit.  

In the future, she would like to open more branches and prove that women can be good business owners.  It is important for her children to continue with their schooling. Hediye is determined to be successful.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff and volunteers


Hediye 37 yaşında ve evli ,yaşları 18 ve 14 olan iki çocuğu var.  Hediye ,6 aydır kadın aksesuarları satıyor. İlk  önceleri hayal kırıkları yaşadı ve  uzun  süre bunlar için çabaladı ve sonunda engelleri  aştı. Etrafımdaki insanların yapamazsın demesini umursamadım ve başardım.  Yeni ürünler almak istiyor, iş yeri daha  yeni olduğu için ,ürün sayısını  çoğaltmak istiyor.  Maya kredisi ile  iş sahamı büyütmek ve daha geniş kitlelerle ticaret yapmak istiyorum.  Bu  sayede müşteri potansiyelinin artmasını sağlayacak.  Şubeler açmak istiyor ve bir kadın olarak neler yapabileceğimi herkese göstermek istiyorum.  Çocuklarının ,öğrenimlerine devam etmesi onun için çok önemli.  Böylece kendine özgüvenini sağlamış olacak.

loans.use: to buy more materials.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Salama sells used clothes and has been in this business for three years. She sells her products on a retail basis at the market. She also sells piped water as her other source of income. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality and increasing prices of clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to start importing used clothes and also to build rental houses. 

Salama lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Dianne Diony

texts.es:
Diony sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y ella sigue dedicándose a la venta de compra y venta de cámaras digitales. En esta oportunidad la socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como por ejemplo cámaras digitales.

Diony está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Diony continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Comuzone III”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She is still in the business of buying and selling digital cameras. Diony is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy merchandise, such as digital cameras.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy digital cameras.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man with five children, four of whom attend school, while one is still too young for school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. His major dream is to expand the business as a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES (Kenya shillings) he wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. Julius decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi is a widow and has seven children, three of whom still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water, and her greatest monthly expense is buying food for her family. For the past five years, she has operated a mat-weaving business, selling her goods to neighbors and passersby in a local market. Her biggest challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business so that she can supply to a larger market in the future. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 10,000 to buy materials to make more mats. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making mats.

loans.name: Mery Luz

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Mery; ella tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,ella prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas y tambien tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,por medio de estso negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,pollo,carne y verduras y tambien para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite.
su sueño de la socia es tener otro restaurant.
 


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Mery is 42 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. She continues with her restaurant business where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Mery also has a grocery store where she sells products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. Through these businesses, she is able to help her children move forward. Mery wants to expand both of her businesses, so she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for cooking such as rice, chicken, meat, and vegetables and also products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. Her dream is to open another restaurant.

Mery is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant and merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for her law studies.

loans.name: Yhury

texts.es:
Yhury sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y él sigue dedicándose a la venta de cerveza. En estos últimos días Yhury se está dedicando también a la venta de artesanía. En esta oportunidad el socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de artesanía como chompas de alpaca.

Yhury está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Yhury continues to participate in the Asociación Arariwa "Comuzone III" community bank in the city of Cusco, and he still works as a beer vendor.  Recently he's also been selling handicrafts.  He is currently seeking a loan to buy handicrafts like alpaca sweaters.

Yhury is happy for the loan and promises to make all his payments.

loans.use: to buy more beer.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella administra una panadería, inicio con el apoyo de su madre y su esposo, el negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación, no hay un horario establecido porque depende de la demanda, ya posee experiencia y en el negocio trabajan todos hasta sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima para la elaboración del pan como es harina, manteca, huevos, azúcar, levadura, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar e incrementar la producción de pan, atendiendo mejor a la clientela.
La aspiración de Rosa es que su negocio crezca, adquirir su propia casa y proveer para su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and children.  She runs a bakery, which she opened with support from her mother and husband.  The business is located in her house.  Her schedule isn't set, but depends on demand.  She's got experience, and everyone works in the business, even the kids.  

Rosa is seeking a loan to buy bread-baking ingredients like flour, lard, eggs, sugar, and yeast.  This investment will help her improve and increase bread production, offering better service to her clientele.  She aspires to grow the business, get her own house, and provide the necessities to her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, eggs, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand a farm.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She is a poultry farmer and has been in this business for 10 years. She sells her products on a retail basis from home. 

Oliver gets additional income through rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feeds. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the increasing prices of clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to own 1000 chickens and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feeds.

loans.name: Laure Estelle Rachel

texts.fr:
JEUNE FEMME DE 39ANS, CÉLIBATAIRE ET MÈRE DE 3 ENFANTS DONT L’AGE VARIE ENTRE 8 ET 22 ANS. APRÈS SA FORMATION DE COUPE ET COUTURE, ELLE A COMMENCER  A CONFECTIONNER LES TENUE POUR VENDRE EN 1998.
DE NOS JOURS, ELLE A UNE ATELIER DE COUTURE  AVEC DEUX  APPRENTIES  QUI L’ AIDENT A FAIRE DES PETIT TS TRAVAUX  TEL  QUE S  REPASSAGE, FINITIONS , COLLER LES DOUBLURES ET AUTRES.ELLE CONFECTIONNE LES TENUS DES PAGNES MÉLANGES ET DES ROBE GENRE KABA  QU ELLE VEND  A DES PRIS RAISONNABLES .
SES RECETTES PAR SEMAINES VARIENT ENTRE  25000 F ET 150000F.
 ELLE A REMBOURSÉE  LES TROIS PREMIERS PRÊT SANS DÉFAUTS DE PAYEMENTS ET SON ÉPARGNE EST  CONSIDÉRABLE.          
AVEC LE PRÊT ACTUELLE, ELLE VA  ACHETÉE  LES TISSUS DE CÉRÉMONIES,  LES ACCESSOIRES DE COUTURES (FERMETURES,  VASELINE,  AIGUILLES, DOUBLURES, FILES, SATIN, MOUSTIQUAIRE, DENTELLE….).
LES DIFFICULTÉS MAJEURS SONT : LE MANQUE ÉLECTRICITÉ ET L4 INFLATION DES PRIX DES ACCESSOIRES SUR LE MARCHE.
C’EST UNE FEMME TRÈS ENTREPRENANTE QUI VEUT ATTEINDRE SON OBJECTIF CELUI D’ENCADRER LES  JEUNES  FILLE S  MÈRES,  ACHETER UNE MACHINE A COUDRE INDUSTRIELLE  ET FAIRE UN GRAND  ATELIER DE CONFECTION ET VENTE DE SA CRÉATION.  
FEMME SEULE, ELLE S’OCCUPE BIEN DE LA SCOLARITÉ DE SES ENFANTS AVEC CE QU’ELLE GAGNE.
texts.en:
Laure Estelle Rachel is a young woman, 39 years of age, single and the mother of three children whose ages range from 8 to 22 years old. After her training in cutting and sewing, she began to create clothing to sell in 1998.

These days, she has a sewing shop with two female apprentices who help her with odd jobs such as ironing, adding trim, pressing linings, etc. She creates mixed pagnes [traditional clothing] and Kaba-style dresses, which she sells at reasonable prices.

Her weekly revenue varies between 25,000 and 150,000 CFA francs.

Laure Estelle Rachel has repaid her first three loans with no missing payments and her savings are significant.

With this current loan, she will purchase ceremonial fabrics and sewing incidentals (fastenings, Vaseline, needles, linings, thread, satin, mosquito netting, lace...).

The main difficulties are the lack of electricity and the inflation of the price of incidentals at the market.

She is a very enterprising woman who wants to reach her goal, which is to supervise young single mothers, to purchase an industrial sewing machine and to establish a large shop for sewing and selling her creations.

A single woman, she takes care of her the costs of her children's education with what she earns.

loans.use: To purchase sewing incidentals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, es comerciante de medicinas, vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos, ella aprendió el negocio de la medicina trabajando con una amiga, quien le enseño para cotizar los precios, trabaja en su propia casa, no tiene un horario fijo y ya posee experiencia en el negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo, pues quiere comprar un lote de medicinas, para vender la compra le ayudara para mantener a disponibilidad de los clientes, un surtido de jarabes, pastillas, inyecciones, de medicamentos y vitaminas,  esta inversión le ayudara para fortalecer su negocio.
Ella quiere tener un negocio grande, con más clientela y proveer para su familia lo necesario, permitiéndole vivir en otras condiciones.
texts.en:
María sells medicines for a living.  She lives with her family, her husband and two children.  She learned the medicine business working with a friend who taught her to give quotes on the prices.  She works from home and doesn't have a fixed schedule.  She already has experience in this business.  

She is requesting a loan to buy medicines to have on hand for her customers to buy.  She will stock medicines in the form of syrups, pills, injections, and also vitamins.  This investment will help her to strengthen her business.  

She wants to have a large business with more customers and to give her family what they need, allowing them to live in other conditions.

loans.use: buy medicines such as syrups, pills, injections and vitamins to stock her business.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
a socia es la Sra. Nélida; ella tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia
se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de sabanas,colchas y cobertores,ella tiene una tienda que trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de sabanas,colchas y cobertores,el sueño de la socia es tener otra tienda de vehnta de juegos de cama.La socia solicita el préstamo para la comprar mercaderia como sabanas,colchas y cobertores al por mayor. 
 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se
compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nélida is 52 years old, married, and has four children.  She continues working in her business selling sheets, bedspreads and comforters.  She has a stall where she works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through this business, she provides for her children.  Nélida would like to expand and improve her business selling sheets, bedspreads and comforters.  Her dream is to have another bed linen stall.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as sheets, bedspreads and comforters wholesale.

Nélida is grateful to the people who will take part in her dream in this way and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sheets, bedspreads and comforters wholesale

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa Victoria sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y ella sigue ejerciendo su profesión pero ahora empezó con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes. En esta oportunidad Rosa Victoria solicita el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes.  

Rosa Victoria está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Rosa Victoria is still participating in the communal bank "Comuzone III", from the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. She is also still practising her profession but now she is has started a business of breeding small animals, such as guinea pigs. On this occasion Rosa Victoria is requesting the loan to buy more small animals like guinea pigs.

Rosa Victoria is very pleased to be receiving the loan and she promises to make all her repayments.

loans.use: to buy more small animals such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for a jewelery shop.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es: El señor Abrahan, se dedica a la elaboración de pan junto a su esposa para luego poner el producto a la venta; además presta servicios de transporte en su movilidad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora para llevar un mejor control en su negocio y así llevar mejor sus inventarios, costos de materias primas y márgenes de utilidad. Abrahan está casado y tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa alquilada la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un préstamo en IMPRO y la segunda vez a través de kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Abrahan works with his wife making bread which he later sells.  He also offers transportation services with his vehicle.

He is requesting the loan to purchase a computer to gain better control over his business and so improve his inventory management, raw material costs and profit margins.

Abrahan is married with two children.  He lives in a rented home, which is located in the Llojeta area of La Paz city.

This is his fourth time requesting a loan from IMPRO, and his second time borrowing through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a computer that will help him better manage his business baking and selling bread.

loans.name: Kwembe Group

texts.en: Frolence, who is in her twenties, is married and has no children. She has a retail, food products shop and works from 6 am to 6 pm daily.  Frolence is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Frolences's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more stock for her food shop. She has successfully paid back all her loans. Frolence is requesting another loan to further increase her stock. Her dream is to one day have a wholesale food products business. Frolence will share this loan with her loan group "Kwembe", which has a total of 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to expand her shop.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with one six-year-old child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years she has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase men's, women's, and children's clothing. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: New Dawn Group

texts.en:
This is 41 year old Cleopas from Machipisa, Harare. He is married with three children, two of whom attend school. 

Cleopas runs a tailoring business. The business has been in operation for nine years. He says the main challenge he faces is competition, as other players are entering the industry with cheaper products. 

Cleopas has requested a loan of $400 to buy raw materials like fabric and thread. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to be able to pay school fees and rentals on time. In the future, Cleopas plans to have a large machine shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing thread

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two sisters). 

Sarah has a business of market vending. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Sarah sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  Sarah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, and bags of Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Sarah include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked food stall and also to start growing some food stuffs herself. 

She also generates additional income through renting houses. Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, and bags of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Sylvie Idé

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Sylvie s'est spécialisée dans la couture; activité qu'elle exerce dans son quartier. Ele  y associe la vente de pagnes, maïs et haricot dans son quartier bien peuplé ayant le monopole de son entourage; ce qui lui permet de commercialiser très rapidement son produit. Pour accroître sa productivité et  satisfaire  la demande haussante de sa clientèle, elle fait donc recours à Finadev. Sylvie vise à maximiser alors son profit pour  renforcer son stock et surtout pour subvenir en partie aux dépenses de son foyer.
texts.en: Married and mother of four children, Sylvie is specialized in sewing, an occupation that she practices in her area. She combines with this the sale of pagnes (colorful wax cloths), corn and beans in her well-populated area, and has the monopoly in her circles. This allows her to rapidly market her products. To increase her productivity and satisfy the increased demand of her clients, she has turned to Finadev. Sylvie aims to maximize her profits to reinforce her stock, and especially to provide for a part of her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 30 pagnes, 4 sacks of corn, sacks of beans and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Joel Elias

texts.es:
Joel, vive acompañado de su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, el administra un taller de estructuras metálicas elaborando puertas, ventanas, portones todo elaborado de hierro, este negocio nació con la intención de mejorar los ingresos familiares y administrar su propio negocio.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de hierro, electrodos, discos, acero y lámina, éstos maten materiales le ayudarán para dinamizar su trabajo haciendo más fácil la entrega sus trabajos en menor tiempo y con mayor calidad.
La aspiración de Joel y crecer en su taller y montar otro en un lugar cercano para ir creciendo en la zona
texts.en:
Joel lives with his wife and two young children. He runs a metal workshop where he makes structures such as doors, windows and gates, all produced from iron. This business was started with the intention of improving the family's income and of running his own business.

He is requesting a loan to buy iron, electrodes, discs, steel and laminates. These materials will help him to boost his business, making it easier for him to complete his jobs more quickly and to a higher quality.

Joel's wish is to develop his workshop and set up another nearby so that he can grow within the area.

loans.use: to buy iron, electrodes, disks, steel and laminates.

loans.name: Frank Howard

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Frank; el tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,el socio tambien esta trabajndo en una empresa privada en el area de limpieza y sigue estudiando en la carrera de turismo,el socio quiere terminar de estudiar y poder salir adelante,su sueño del socio es ampliar su tienda de abarrotes.El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,aceite y leche al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Frank is 25 years old, single, and has one child. He continues to manage his grocery business, but he also works for a private company in the cleaning department. Frank is continuing his studies toward a degree in Tourism. He wants to finish his education so that he can get ahead. His dream is to expand his grocery store. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy products for his store such as rice, sugar, oil, and milk in bulk.

Frank is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and milk in bulk.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El señor Ramiro trabaja en una de las Compañías proveedoras de televisón por cable de la ciudad de La Paz, desempeñando las funciones en el departamento de transmisión, Energía y laboratorio. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad  que es un apoyo para su trabajo el cual lo  desempeña en las provincias de la ciudad hasta donde llega la señal. Ramiro tiene una hija la cual esta a su cargo .Vive en casa alquilada la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Bajo San Antonio de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es  la  primera vez que solicita crédito en una institución financiera y también  en kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramiro works for one of the companies that provide cable television services in the city of La Paz. He works in the transmission, energy, and laboratory departments. The loan he is requesting will be used to maintain his vehicle, which is a great help in his work as he travels to different areas of the city that receive a television signal. Ramiro has one daughter who is a dependent. He lives in a rented house in the District of Bajo San Antonio in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from a financial institution, as well as from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay vehicle maintenance costs.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is a married woman with two children, ages 1 and 7 years old. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 6 years, she has operated a business selling cereals, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Rodah dreams of establishing a cereals business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, rice and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, rice and beans

loans.name: Rose Baï

texts.fr: Rose vit avec son mari et a trois enfants. Coiffeuse de formation, elle vend en plus des produits cosmétiques, mêches, tissus et son atelier se trouve au bord de la voie. Elle exerce ses activités sur fonds propres et s'approvisionne dans les marchés environnant. Dans l'objectif de diversifier son  activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus accrue, Rose aimerait bien le revouvellement de son micro crédit à Finadev. Par conséquent, elle vise à maximiser ses intérêts et surtout à contribuer aux charges de son foyer de plus en plus pesantes.
texts.en: Rose lives with her husband and three children. A hairdresser by trade, she also sells cosmetic products, hair extensions and fabrics. Her shop is located along the main road. She uses her own funds for this business and stocks up at the nearby markets. In order to diversify her business and meet the demands of her expanding  customer base, Rose would like to  take out a new microloan with Finadev. Thanks to this loan, she plans to maximize her profits and primarily  contribute to the growing household  charges.

loans.use: 100  hair extensions, 25  big boxes of hair straightening products, 50 small boxes of anti-frizz products,  hair gel and other accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pastas, sauces, sausages, condiments, snack foods, cookies, and candies.

loans.name: Hernestina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Hernestina; ella es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado,la socia tarbaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda ,mas grande de venta de frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Hernestina is single and has one child. She continues to manage her business of selling vegetables and fruits at the market. Hernestina works from 8am to 5pm. Through this business, she is able to help her children move forward. She dreams of having a large store where she can sell fruits and vegetables. Hernestina is requesting a loan to buy vegetables and fruits for her business.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita  se dedica a la venta de variedad de frutas; su esposo trabaja como albañil. El crédito que requiere es para la construcción de una habitación nueva en su casa, para tener mayor comodidad para su familia. Margarita es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Alto Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito; el análisis del mismo muestra que tiene ingresos suficientes para cubrir los pagos mensuales, además de que mejorará su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita sells a variety of fruits while her husband works as a bricklayer. The loan she is requesting will be used to build a new room in her house, which will provide greater comfort for her family. Margarita is married and has four children. She lives in her own home in the District of Alto Tacagua in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has requested a loan. The analysis indicates that she has sufficient income to cover her monthly payments. In addition, the loan will improve the standard of living for herself and her children.

loans.use: to pay the construction costs for building a new room in her house.

loans.name: Matano

texts.en:
Matano is a single man who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His monthly expense is school fees for his young siblings.

For the past 3 years, he has operated a battery charging and mobile sales business, selling as retail to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of power shortages in the business.

With the 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase mobile phone chargers and calling cards for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone chargers and calling cards for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 5 years, she has operated a boutique business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing another boutique business in the future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase new clothes, handbags and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes, handbags and shoes for resale

loans.name: Mariliz

texts.es:
Mariliz sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y ella sigue dedicándose a la venta de comestibles pero también se está dedicando a la venta de comida. En esta oportunidad Mariliz solicita el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Mariliz está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Mariliz continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Comuzone III” which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She still sell groceries, but she also sells prepared foods. Mariliz is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more supplies such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, oil, and other products.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, and carpets

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de 23, 26 y 28 años de edad, administra un molino de nixtamal, donde ofrece el servicio a los vecinos para moler granos básicos, tiene 16 años en esta actividad, trabaja todos los días de 5:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, cerámica para mejorar la vivienda, esta compra le ayudara para mantener su casa en mejor condición para vivir con sus hijos.
La aspiración de María es terminar la construcción de la vivienda.
texts.en:
María is a single mother with three children (ages 23, 26, and 28). She manages a mill that processes cornmeal. María offers her service to neighbors who need to process basic grains. She has been in business for 16 years and works every day from 5am to 3pm.

María is currently requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, and ceramic tiles in order to improve her home. This purchase will help keep her home in good condition so that her children can live in it. María aspires to finish the construction of her home.

loans.use: to buy materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase potatoes, onions, and fruits

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Demetrio;  El tiene 55 años de edad,  es  padre soltero y tiene 1 hijo;  se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos agricolas como tomates,papas y maiz,el lleva a lugares como Arequipa y Tacna,por medio de este negcoio el socio saca adelante a su hijo,su sueño del socio es salir adelante por su hijo y ampliar y tener una tienda donde pueda vender los productos agricolas . El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar productos agricolas como tomates,papas y maiz al por mayor.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Demetrio is 55 years old and a single father of one child. He is a small businessman who continues to sell farm products such as tomatoes, potatoes, and corn. Demetrio brings his goods to places such as Arequipa and Tacna. Through this business, he is able to help his son get ahead. His dream is to move forward with his son and open a store where he can sell farm produce. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farm produce such as tomatoes, potatoes, and corn in bulk.

Demetrio appreciates and values the loan, so he promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy farm produce such as tomatoes, potatoes, and corn.

loans.name: Mwarabu

texts.en:
Mwarabu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a food stall, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. In addition she also operates a boutique, which serves as another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish another boutique business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and bundles of rice, beans, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and bundles of rice, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alicia Stella

texts.es:
Alicia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y ella sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida y venta de productos de belleza. En esta oportunidad Alicia solicita el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Alicia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Alicia continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Comuzone III” which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She still sells food and beauty products. Alicia is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more supplies such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other products.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, solar panels, TVs, DVDs, and inverters

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: La señora Teofila se dedica a la preparación de masitas, como alfajores, pequeños pasteles, etc., para luego ponerlas a la venta. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser harina, azúcar, polvo de hornear, huevos, etc. Teofila tiene cuatro hijos los cuales no están a su cargo. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Alto Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz. Teofila es cliente de Impro desde el año 2008 y esta es la segunda vez que su solicitud es canalizada a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Teofila prepares baked treats, such as shortbread cookies and miniature pastries, and then sells them. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, baking powder, eggs, and other products. Teofila has four children, but they are no longer under her care. She lives in a rented house in the District of Alto Tacagua in the city of La Paz.

Teofila has been a client of IMPRO since 2008 and this is the second time that her request has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, eggs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Carmen; ella tiene 43 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al ngeocio de compra y venta de terrenos,ella vende terrenos y recibe comision,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio propio como una tienda de venta de ropa y tambien quiere terminar de construir su casa.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construccion como arena,cemento y pintura para que termine de construir su casa.
 

La socia feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is Señora Carmen, who is 43 years old and married with four children.  She is still working buying and selling plots of land. She sells land and receives commission.  The member works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, and by means of this work, the member has been able to move her children ahead in life.  

The member's dream is to have her own business, such as a store selling clothing, and also to finish building her home.

The member is requesting the loan to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement and pain so that she can finish building her home.

The member is happy about the loan, and agrees to comply with her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement and paint so that she can finish building her home.

loans.name: Malombo

texts.en:
Malombo lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married, has six children, and owns a grocery stall which has been in operation for ten years. She was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined in order to access credit.

Malombo is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase vegetables. She will use the income obtained from the business to purchase furniture. 

She looks forward to opening a big stall and employing many people. Her only challenge is some credited clients not paying on time.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two sisters).

Victo has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Victo sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  Victo has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenges for Victo include on-and-off electricity and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked salon and also educate her children up to university.

She also generates additional income through poultry farming. Victo lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding her family

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, who both attend school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Annet lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food and rent.

Annet has operated a restaurant for 3 years, selling her products on a retail basis from home. She also has a beauty salon as her other source of income. Annet works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy beef, rice, bananas and flour for her restaurant and braids for her salon. Annet's major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and hopes are to build rental houses and to own a fully stocked restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more beef, rice, bananas and flour for her restaurant and braids for her salon

loans.name: Rossana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rossana, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y joyería por catalogo, ella vive con su esposo y dos hijos, trabaja de manera ambulante, visitando clientes en las viviendas o sitios de trabajos, para ofrecer productos de las revistas con las que trabaja.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos para vender a  detalle, por ejemplo,labiales, lociones, maquillajes, collares, aretes, pulseras, comprando ella de sus revistas los productos más llamativos, así tener disponibilidad para ofrecer a los clientes. Esta inversión espera que le ayude para que sus clientes se animen a comprar más productos.
Su aspiración es mejorar el negocio y su casa, que sus hijos también tengan lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Rossana works selling cosmetics and jewelry from catalogs.  She lives with her husband and two children.  She sells her products by visiting her customers in their homes or workplaces, where she offers products for sale from the catalogs with which she works.

She is requesting a loan to purchase products to retail, for example lipsticks, lotions, make-up, necklaces, earrings, and bracelets.  She purchases the most requested products from her catalogs, so that she always has them available to sell to her customers.  She hopes that this investment will help her as her customers will be encouraged to purchase more products.

Her aspiration is to improve her business and her home, so that her children will have everything necessary for their development.

loans.use: to purchase lipsticks, lotions, make-up, necklaces, earrings, and bracelets.

loans.name: Cesar Mateo

texts.es:
Cesar Mateo sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y él   sigue dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. En esta oportunidad Cesar Mateo solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimentos para sus cuyes como pasto, maíz, comida mejorada para sus animalitos.

Cesar Mateo está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Cesar Mateo continues as a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Comuzone III" community bank in Cusco.  He continues raising animals such as guinea pigs.  On this occasion, Cesar Mateo is requesting a loan to buy food for his guinea pigs such as fodder, corn and improved feed.  He is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy food for his guinea pigs such as fodder, corn and improved feed

loans.name: Mame Cheikh Ibra Fall Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 novembre 2011. Il est composé de 09 femmes. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et affinité. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Aby, debout à l'extrême de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant.

Elle développe un petit commerce de matériel électroniques (appareils téléviseurs, téléphones portables,etc.) Elle a une expérience avérée dans ce domaine pour d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis environs 08 ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit de 50.000 francs elle compte renforcer son capital pour augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises.

Avec les bénéfices générés par son activité elle va renforcer son activité car elle dit vouloir implanter un grand magasin dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created November 23, 2011. It consists of nine women. They came together as neighbors and through personal affinities. Their main activity is petty trade.

Ms. Aby, standing at the extreme left of the photo, is the group leader. She is 29 years old, single with no children.

She is developing a small business dealing in electronic equipment (televisions, mobile phones, etc.). She has an accumulated eight years of experience in her field of activity.

Her new loan of 50,000 francs will bolster her capital so she can increase her stock supply level.

The profits generated by her activity will enable her to strengthen her business, as she intends to open a department store in the future.

loans.use: purchase electronic equipment for resale.

loans.name: Phustina

texts.en:
Phustina is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, Phustina has operated a water sales business. She also owns real estate houses which provide her with another source of income. Phustina faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. She dreams of establishing another business of a boutique in the future. 

Phustina plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to repair her water pump. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to repair her water pump.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has three children. George owns a transport business which he began six months ago from personal savings. He learned of Milango from his friends.

George is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 to service his motorcycle and purchase some spare parts. He looks forward to purchasing more motor bikes in the future. George's main challenge is high fuel costs.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle and purchase some spare parts

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single mother of three children; two attend school while one is still too young. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Agnes has operated a wine and spirits business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a clothes sales business which provides her with another source of income. She faces a challenge of inflation in her business. 

Agnes plans to use this KES 70,000 loan to purchase more stock of wines and spirits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wines and spirits for resale.

loans.name: Ukuri Group

texts.fr:
Isaac  fait partie du groupe Ukuri. Il a 37 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 3 à 14 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Isaac est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Isaac voudrait agrandir la surface de culture en achetant d’autres champs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Isaac is a memeber of the Ukuri group. Il is 37 years old and is married with five children ranging in age from 3 to 14, four of whom are in school. He has had six years of primary schooling.

Isaac grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer.

His strategy for improving the size of this business is to grow exceptional rice. In the coming years, Isaac would like to increase his cultivation area by buying other fields. With his profits, he would like to ensure that his children receive an education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail, a 35-year-old married father of two children, both of whom are in school, lives in the town of Mubende in Uganda. For the past two years, Ismail has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells both alcoholic beverages and soft drinks to local customers.

To help expand his business, Ismail has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more crates of soda and beer. This will help him to generate greater profits and pay for his children's school and medical fees. In the future, he hopes to be able to buy a vehicle to start a delivery service.

Ismail is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ismail who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.
