loans.use: to purchase more crates of soda and beer.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children, only one of whom goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Allen has a food stall. She has been in this business for 6 years. She sells her products on retail basis at the market, working six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas, tomatoes, onions, and cassava.

Allen's major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked food stall and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, onions, tomatoes, and cassava.

loans.name: Ana Sarai

texts.es:
Ana, esta solicitando nuevamente un prestamo ya que necesita comprarse insumos para la milpa, ya que tiene una nueva siembra y quiere mejorar la productividad fortaleciendo en su crecimiento con abono, tambien quiere prevenirla de cualquier plaga aplicandole herbicidad y plaguicidas, estos materiales son de mucha ayuda para la ejecucion de su trabajo.
Ella ha logrado por medio de estos prestamos salir con sus cosechas, ya que el anterior fue un exito, sacando una buena y abundante produccion.
texts.en: Ana is requesting a new loan as she needs to buy supplies for her corn crop.  She would like to improve her productivity and strengthen her crops' growth with fertilizer.  She would also like to avoid pests by applying herbicides and pesticides.  These materials are very helpful to her in carrying out her work.  Through these loans, Ana has managed to make progress with her harvests as her previous harvest was a success and she achieved good and abundant production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Asha is a widow with four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak in her business. Asha dreams of expanding her poultry business to meet her customers needs. 

With this loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Margaret is taking another Kiva loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to boost her green grocery business. With this loan she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future and earn more profit in the business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Emerita Alicia

texts.es:
Emérita, necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar las pupusas, como maíz, aceite, chicharrón, gaseosas y refrescos naturales, esta nueva inversión es con el propósito de mejorar la atención a los clientes, ofreciendoles algo nuevo, fortaleciendo siempre negocio para una mejor respuesta a quienes consumen sus productos.
Ella ha evolucionado con su negocio a través del apoyo con los préstamos, incrementando sus ventas y mejorando los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Emérita needs a new loan to purchase material for making pupusas like corn, oil, pork rinds, sodas and natural soft drinks. This new investment will improve the customer service and allow her to offer the customers something new. She is always strengthening the business in order to respond better to the people who buy her products.
She has evolved with her business with the support of the loans by increasing her sales and improving the profits for her family.

loans.use: purchase corn, oil, pork rinds, sodas and natural soft drinks.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister).

Alice has a business of secondhand shoes. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Alice sells her products at the market by means of retail. Alice has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand shoes. The main business challenges for Alice include transportation and the increasing prices of used shoes.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to start importing used shoes.  Alice lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en el negocio, ya que quiere comprar más mercadería para las pupusas, ya que este negocio le ha ayudado a mantener a su familia, por medio de los préstamos adquiere los materiales necesarios como aceite, maíz, chicharrón, chocolate, refrescos naturales, para atender la demanda de los clientes.
Ella está contenta porque los préstamos anteriores le han permitido crecer y mejorar la clientela, cambiando su condición y permitiéndole con las ventas cancelar las cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Ana has decided to take out a new loan to invest in her business. She would like to buy more merchandise for her pupusa business as it has helped her to provide for her family. Through her loans Ana acquires the materials she needs such as oil, corn, chicharrón (pork), chocolate and natural drinks, to meet her customer demand. She is happy because her previous loans have allowed her to expand and improve her customer base. She has improved her condition and, through her sales, she has managed to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, chicharrón, chocolate and natural drinks

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yanira, tiene la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar material para hacer las pupusas como: aceite, maíz, chicharrón, gaseosas, estos materiales le ayudarán a mantener el negocio y poder producir venta diariamente.
Los préstamos le han ayudado a mejorar su condición en el negocio, está creciendo y ha podido dar una mejor vida en estos meses a sus familiares, además de cancelar el préstamo anterior.
texts.en:
Yanira needs to invest in her business.  That is why she is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients to make “pupusas” (traditional stuffed tortillas).  She will buy things like oil, corn, chicharrón (fried pork rinds) and soft drinks.  This will help her maintain her business, and it will help her to be able to produce for daily sales.

The loans have helped her to improve the condition of her business.  It is growing, and in these months she has been able to give her family a better life.  She has also been able to completely pay back the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, chicharrón, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with 2 school-going children. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Zawadi has operated a food stall for the past 13 years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access financial services to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Cristian Antonio

texts.es: Cristian, esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo ya que comprara  otros cerdos para la granja, para la temporada de Navidad quiere tener disponibilidad a los clientes que en su cena incluyen la carne de cerdo. Préstamos le han permitido mantener la alimentacion de su familia, pues el anterior prestamo lo invirtio en insumos agricolas, dandole adecuadamente los cuidados al cultivo, cambiando sus circunstancias y el nivel de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Cristian is requesting a new loan as he would like to buy some more pigs for his farm.  During the Christmas season, he would like to have produce available for his customers who include pork as part of their dinner.  The loans that he has received have allowed Cristian to provide food for his family.  He invested his previous loan in buying farm supplies so that he could provide suitable care for his crops.  This improved his situation and also improved his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pigs

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Narlys

texts.es:
Narlys se dedica a la venta de comidas en especial de sopas entre sus vecinos del barrio  en el municipio de Galapa, también vende aunque en menor cantidad almuerzos.  Vive con su cónyuge y su hija de 7 años y estos mismos  de haber emprendido su  negocio; con ello apoya a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, el señor es empleado de una empresa en la ciudad  de Barranquilla donde se desempeña en la labor de  vigilancia y oficios varios.
Sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad lo que le  permite aportar una suma importante a los gastos del hogar,  aunque cuenta con  pocos activos fijos, entre sus metas está organizar su negocio en un local y tener allí toda la infraestructura de un restaurante. Ella gradualmente quiere crecer y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  al por mayor carnes y otros insumos, para la preparación de sus comidas, con el fin de que sus compras le resulten con mayores descuentos y pueda disminuir los costos de producción. Ella planea hacer esta inversión en el mes de Diciembre, cuando usualmente se incrementan sus ventas y aprovechará para minimizare los riesgos en ésta época y es justamente su potencial de exíto.
texts.en:
Narlys serves meals, especially soups, to her neighbors in the municipality of Galapa. She also sells lunches, although in smaller quantities.  She lives with her partner, and her seven year-old daughter, and they are the reason for her starting the business. 

This is how she helps her husband with the household expenses. Her husband is employed by a company in the city of Barranquilla, where he works in security and has other duties. 

Her monthly sales generate a good profit margin, which allows her to contribute a significant amount to the household expenses. Although she has few fixed assets, one of her goals is to set up her business in a permanent location, and to have all the infrastructure of a restaurant. 

She wants to grow over time, and this is the reason why she is applying for her credikiva (loan). This is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy meats and other ingredients for making her meals, at wholesale.  Her aim is to obtain greater discounts on her purchases, so that she can reduce her production costs. 

She is planning to make this investment in the month of December, when her sales usually increase; she will take advantage of the season to minimize her risks and that is precisely her potential for success.

loans.use: To buy meats and other ingredients for making her meals, at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with 2 children: one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Rose has operated a retail shop for the past 6 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of rising commodity prices. She dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale shop.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and a fridge for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial services to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and a fridge for her business

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr: Constance vit maritalement et n'a pas d'enfant à charge. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la mercerie et la vente de divers dans son quartier. Ses approvisionnements se font selon la zone favorable dans les marchés hors de cotonou. Pour accroître son chiffre d' affaire et maximiser son profit , elle compte  renouveller  son micro crédit à Finadev afin d'honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses clients  et d'asurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants. .
texts.en:
Constance lives with a companion and has no dependent children. She specializes selling haberdashery and other items in her neighborhood.

When conditions are favorable she resupplies from markets outside Cotonou.

To increase her turnover and maximize profits, she wants to renew her Finadev micro-credit loan, so she can meet her customer commitments and ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: buy several spools of thread, zippers and buttons, phone recharge cards, etc.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат клиентка организации с 2009 года. Ей 41 год, замужем, имеет троих детей. Она живёт и ведёт свою деятельность в городе Худжанде. Её ассортимент товара составляет нежные домашние лепёшки. Она каждый свой кредит берёт на поддержку своего товарооборота. У неё свои постоянные клиенты. На полученные доходы от бизнеса она старается обновить свою домашнюю обстановку. Вот например недавно она купила новый плазменный телевизор. Она благодарна организации за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Karomat has been a client of the organization since 2009.  She is 41 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives and has her business in the city of Khujand.  She sells delicate homemade breads and has her own regular customers.  

Every time she borrows money, she uses it to support the turnover of her inventory.  With the income she receives from her business, she tries to update her home furnishings and appliances.  For example, she recently bought a new plasma TV.  She is grateful to the organization for its support and understanding.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Renee Bernard

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Renee Bernard; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de bisutería, ella hace trabajos como aretes, collares y pulseras, ella trabaja en forma independiente llevando a tiendas que venden artesanía, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender la bisuteria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como alambres, hilos y lentejuelas para hacer los aretes, collares y pulseras. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Renee Bernard belongs to the "Patron Santiago de Santiago" communal bank. The members live in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and department. She is 51, married, and has three children. 

She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling costume jewellery. She does work such as earrings, necklaces, and bracelets. She works independently, taking her jewellery to stores that sell crafts. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell jewellery.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy materials such as wire, thread, and sequins, for making earrings, necklaces, and bracelets. She is happy to receive the loan and committed to making her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy materials such as wire, thread, and sequins for making earrings, necklaces, and bracelets.

loans.name: Komilhucha

texts.ru: Комилхуча кредитор организции с 2007 года. Он торгует на рынке продуктами питания. Имеет троих детей, жена работает медсестрой в больнице. Сам Комилхуча очень энергичный мужчина, который успевает все и в семье и в бизнесе. Он закупает товар у оптовых фирм и хочет увеличить следующий закуп кондитерских изделий. Комилхуча очень ответственный и пунктуальный мужчина, которому доверяет организация.
texts.en: Komilhucha has been working with the field partner since 2007. He sells groceries at a market. He has 3 children and his wife works as a nurse in a hospital. Komilhucha is a very energetic man who manages to do everything, at home and in his business. He buys the products wholesale and wants to increase the volume of his next confections order. Komilhucha is a very responsible and punctual man who is trusted by the field partner.

loans.use: to purchase of chocolade and other confections

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de mochilas, ella tiene un atienda donde vende todo tipo de mochilas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de mochilas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mochilas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the "Patron Santiago de Santiago" communal bank. It is located in Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco. Cristina is 37, single, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling backpacks.

She has a store where she sells all kinds of backpacks. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm. Her dream is to expand her business. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy backpacks at wholesale.  She is happy to receive the loan, and is committed to making her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy backpacks at wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana Luisa se dedica a la venta de comida, desde hace más de 6 años que tiene este medio de vida. Es una mujer luchadora y triunfadora que con el paso del tiempo ha logrado adquirir la experiencia necesaria. La mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos con los diferentes platillos que ofrece. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, refrescos, pan, bolsas, frutas entre otros.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa works selling food; she has had this means of earning a living for more than six years.  She is a hard-working and achieving woman, who with the passage of time has been able to acquire the necessary experience.  The majority of her customers are satisfied with the different dishes she offers for sale.  

The reason for the loan is to purchase rice, beans, oil, soda, bread, bags, and fruit among other things.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, soda, bread, bags and fruit, among other things.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married woman with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school while 1 is still too young for school. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Everline has operated a food stall for the past 6 years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 35,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stocks of rice, cooking fat, potatoes and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice, cooking fat, potatoes and wheat flour for her business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, tiene la necesidad de volver a invertir en el negocio, comprara más mercadería para los tamales , comprando aceite, maíz, tomates, condimentos, frijol y pollo, esta nueva compra espera que le de los buenos resultados y pueda aumentar sus ventas.
Ella ha logrado mejorar el negocio, a apoyado a su hijo en los estudios, en la actualidad se encuentra bien y con muchas esperanzas de continuar mejorando.
texts.en:
Once again María needs to put some money into her business. She plans to buy more ingredients for the tamales she makes such as oil, corn, tomatoes, condiments, beans and chicken. She hopes that this new investment will bring her good results and lead to increased sales. 

María has managed to improve her business and help her son with his education. All is going well for her at the moment and she has great hopes that it will continue to get even better.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, tomatoes, condiments, beans and chicken

loans.name: Roy Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Roy Angel; el tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes como muñecas, carros entre otros juguetes, el socio junto con su esposa trabajan este negocio y también el socio  se dedica al negocio de transporte, el hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de juguetería y mejorar en el negocio de servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes y también el mantenimiento de su carro como comprar repuestos.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Roy Angel is a member of the Patron Santiago de Santiago Community Bank located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name. He is 29 years old, married, and has two children. As well as the usual daily activities, he and his wife run a business selling toys such as dolls and cars. Roy is also a taxi driver in the streets of Cusco.

His dream is to expand the toy business and improve his taxi service. He is seeking a loan to buy toys and also to buy spare parts so he can maintain his vehicle.

Roy is happy to have the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to repay it.

loans.use: to buy toys and also to buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya.  He is married and has three children.  He owns a grocery store, which has been in operation for the past four months. He began this business with money he received from his parents.

Abraham joined Milango to access credit and obtain the capital required to improve his business. He is applying for a loan of 30,000 KES to construct a new site for his business. 

Abraham’s main challenge is high fuel costs that increase the cost of most produce.  He will use the extra income obtained from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to construct a new site for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new washing machines

loans.name: Abatiganda/cyrkr Group

texts.fr:
Sylvain   fait partie du groupe Abatiganda/Cyrkr. Il a 33 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 2 à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.

Sylvain est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Sylvain voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants
texts.en:
Sylvain is a member of the Abatiganda/Cyrkr group. He is 33 years old and is married with five children ranging in age from 2 to 12, three of whom are in school. He has received 8 years of primary schooling.

Sylvain grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer.

His strategy for increasing the size of his business is to enlarge his rice cultivation area. In the coming years, Sylvain would like to be a rice provider for his region. With his profits, he plans to ensure that his children receive an education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Thérèse Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 51ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants , elle  a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs cycles de crédit.

 Il ya 17ans, elle ouvre un petit restaurant à domicile, non loin de l'aéroport.
Son restaurant ouvre très tôt , ses clients sont les manœuvres qui travaillent non loin de l'aeropport et   les taxi mans, elle fait des menus de  bouillons de la viande de porc ,  du mouton et de l'haricot a la sauce tomate.
Ses recettes journalières sont comprises entre 50000F et 200000F .
 Elle a remboursée ses prêts sans défauts de paiements et a fait des épargnes considérables .

 Avec l’actuel prêt, elle va acheter : 10 kilos de viande de mouton, 10 kilo de viande de porc, 1 carton de poisson salé, 1 panier  du poisson fumé  1 bidon de 10 litres d’huile, 1/2 filet d’oignons, 1carton de cubes, 20 boites de tomates  concentrées, 1sac de charbon, du 10 paquets fagots de bois de chauffe,rajouter  les ustensiles de cuisines. 
Pour le futur , elle pense a ouvrir un grand restaurant parce qu'elle a une grande clientèle, elle s'occupe valablement de sa famille et participe activement au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maman is 51 years old, married and mother to 10 children. She is a client of HOPE and is on her 4th loan cycle. Seventeen years ago, she started little by little to sell meals in her neighborhood. 

Her restaurant opens very early with the passers-by and from 12:30pm workers from the aeroport and surrounding companies. As well as grilled meat, she makes broths from pork and lamb meat and beans in tomato sauce.

Her daily profits are between 50000F and 200000F after paying salaries. 

She has paid back with savings to move on to the next loan cycle of the united group.

With the actual loan, she is going to buy: 1 sheep, 1 pig, 1 carton of salted fish, 1 basket of smoked fish, 1 10L can of oil, 1/2 string bag of onions, 1 carton of cubes, 20 boxes of tomato concentrate, 1 bag of coal, 10 bundles of sticks of wood for heating, reinforce the plates, forks and spoons.

Her prices are affordable and she attracts clients with varied and special menus. Her goal is to open little restaurants in the other neighborhoods.

People call her: mother boss.

loans.use: to buy 1 pig, 1 sheep, salted fish, smoked fish, can of oil, 1/2 string bag of onions, tomatoes in boxes, bag of coal, wood for heating, plates, forks, spoons, cubes, pepper, spices

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.fr: Isabelle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Ayant pour activité principale la vente de divers au grand marché , elle les vend en carton et en détail et fait son approvisionnement dans le même marché chez des grossistes. Pour  faire face à la demande de cette clientèle qui ne cesse de s'accroître, elle opte pour le renouvellement de son micro-crédit à Finadev. Dame Isabelle vise à maximiser ses intérêts  et à supporter en partie les dépenses de son foyer et surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Isabelle is married and mother to three children. 

Her main business is selling a variety of items at the large market, which she sells both individually and by the carton, and she gets her supplies at the same market at the wholesaler's. 

To respond to the demand from her clients which doesn't stop growing, she has opted to renew her micro-loan with Finadev. 

Madam Isabelle aims to maximize her interests and to partially pay for her household expenses and especially her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 25 large bottles of mayonnaise, 100 1kg bags of rice, 100 1L bottles of oil and other items.

loans.name: Nelius

texts.en: Nelius is requesting another Kiva loan of 40,000 KES to boost her M-PESA (mobile phone based money transfer) business. With this loan, she plans to increase the money float she uses in her money transfer business. She dreams of establishing a second M-PESA business in the future.

loans.use: to increase the money float for her mobile phone based money transfer business.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina forma parte del Banco comunal “Ilusión y una Esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante, vende ropa usada y accesorios de todo tipo, se dedica a esto desde hace 5 años.
Trabaja de lunes a domingo desde su casa y también en ferias libres. Ella cuenta con mucha clientela
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago por encomienda, ya que ella deposita el dinero y le envían su mercadería (fardos de ropa usada) al terminal de buses en la ciudad de Talca. 
Con el crédito comprará accesorios y juguetes, productos que venderá exclusivamente para la temporada de navidad, además comprará una congeladora para vender helados y bebidas durante la temporada de verano en la feria. 
Sus metas son comprarse una camioneta que le permita trasladar su mercadería, ya que por ahora utiliza un triciclo y a veces paga fletes (alquiler de un medio de transporte), lo que es sacrificado y costoso. 
Georgina vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son instalar un local establecido en su casa, ya que esto le permitiría pasar mayor tiempo en su casa, para cuidar a sus hijos. Otro de sus sueños es prosperar en su negocio, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos. 
Ella está muy agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que comenta que sin esta no contaría con su negocio, le ha servido mucho para invertir en mercadería. 
El grupo del banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido y responsable, además realizan actividades juntos.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, ha podido asistir a todas, de las cuales ha aprendido sobre contabilidad, especialmente para distribuir sus gastos e ingresos.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the Communal Bank “Ilusión y Una Esperanza” (Illusion and A Hope) which is in the city of Talca. She is a traveling merchant who sells used clothing and all types of accessories. Georgina has been in this business for five years.

She works Monday through Sunday from home but also at the open fairs. Georgina has many customers. Her merchandise is purchased in the city of Santiago and then shipped. She deposits the money and the merchandise (bundles of used clothing) is shipped to the bus terminal in the city of Talca.

With this loan she will buy accessories and toys, products that she will sell exclusively for the Christmas season. In addition, she will buy a cooler so that she can sell ice cream treats and beverages during the summer at the fair. Her goals include buying a truck so that she can transport her merchandise. She currently uses a tricycle, but sometimes she will rent a vehicle, which requires sacrifice and cost.

Georgina lives with her husband and two children, age 9 and 6. Her dreams on a personal level include establishing a store in her house, which would allow her to spend more time at home to look after her children. Another goal is to prosper her business so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family and pay for her children’s higher education.

Georgina is very grateful for the support Fondo Esperanza has provided. She says that she would not have a business without it because the assistance she received enabled her to invest in merchandise. Her Communal Bank group is very close and responsible. In addition, they participate in activities together. With regard to the training, Georgina attends all of the classes and has learned accounting, especially the distribution of her expenses and income.

Talca is in the region of Maule and is located in the central part of the country. It is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region and is one of the most important cities in the Chilean Central Valley. One curious reference to Talca that is used in Chile is the phrase, “Talca, Paris, and London”. Some say that the phrase was originally attributed to an Englishman who said, “Talca feels like London” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city during winter, just like in the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy accessories and toys to sell for the Christmas season and a cooler for selling ice cream treats and beverages at the fairs.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Bara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sérigne Bara a été crée le 20-04-2010. Il est composé de 8 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles exercent la même activité qui est le commerce.

Marie (Debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de d'arachides et de "bissap" communément appelé oseille. 

Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenté son niveau d'approvisionnement en arachide et "bissap" pour revendre.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
Notons que une des membres est absente sur la photo.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Sop Sérigne Bara, was created on April 20, 2010. It is composed of 8 women, all from the same area. They all partake in commerce.

Marie (standing, on the right) is the leader of the group. She is 31 years old. She is married and is the mother of 5 children.

She sells peanuts and "bissap", commonly referred to as oseille, on a small scale.

With her loan, she will increase her supply of peanuts and "bissap" to sell.

Her profits will allow her to support her husband in taking care of the family's needs. Please note that one of the group members is absent in the photo.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and bissap

loans.name: Alex Efrain

texts.es: El sr. Alex es Chapista (arreglo de movilidades, pintado) hace varios años,  vive en casa familiar en la casa de los Papás del Titular, tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el taller que tiene el cliente es en la casa de sus papás, otro ingreso es el puesto de comida que tiene la esposa en el mercado cerca de la zona donde viven, ambos trabajan por el bienestar de su familia, ya que desean un bienestar para sus hijos  El crédito lo invertirán en compra de algunas herramientas  para su taller de chapería y compra de materiales de construcción  para techar el taller ya que esta época es época de lluvia  y esto le perjudica en el trabajo diario, y con el techado podrá ya trabajar sin dificultad, es Sr. Alex es una persona joven con ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el trabajo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Alex is an auto mechanic who has been performing paint and body work for several years. He lives in the home of his parents and has three school-age children. His workshop is located at his parents’ house. To earn additional income, his wife operates a food stall at a nearby market in the district where they live. Both of them work for the welfare of their family. They desire the best for their children.

Alex will invest in this loan in the purchase of equipment for his repair shop and construction materials so that he can install a roof over his shop for the rainy season, which can have a negative impact on his daily work. Having a roof will allow him to work without any difficulties. Sr. Alex is a young person who has the desire to succeed. He is grateful to Emprender for the work it has done.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and construction materials for installing a roof over his repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail goods; e.g., bread, flour, sugar etc.

loans.name: Théophile

texts.fr:
Théophile est  un homme âgé de 52 ans. Il est marié  å un/e informaticienne/Revendeuse et a 03 enfants.
Théophile travaille comme revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 1996. Il vend dans une boutique et achète les produits à Lomé.
Théophile a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d'acheter plus de marchandises.
texts.en:
Théophile is a 52 year old man. He is married to a computer specialist/retailer and has 3 children.

Théophile has been working as a retailer of general food products since 1996. He buys the products in Lomé and sells them in a shop.

Théophile is asking for a second loan through WAGES in order to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy general food productis

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es: La señora Yrma se dedica a la elaboración de alfajores,  galletas y panes,  su estado civil es casada, nacida en el departamento de Cochabamba,  vive actualmente en la zona  Blooming de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de alfajores, bombones, queques, tortas y otros hace 4 años,  trabaja de lunes a sábado. Su negocio esta ubicado  en su mismo domicilio y distribuye en diferentes supermercados de la ciudad. La señora demuestra ser responsable y trabajadora con espíritu emprendedor ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar. El crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra de insumos como harina y azúcar en mayor cantidad por época de fin de año . La señora esta muy agradecida con emprender por confiar en ella y poder darle la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Yrma prepares shortbread wafers, cookies, and breads. She is married and was born in the Department of Cochabamba. Yrma currently lives in the District of Blooming in the city of Santa Cruz de La Sierra.

She has been producing shortbreads, bonbons, cupcakes, cakes, and other sweets for four years. Yrma works Monday through Saturday. Her business is located in her home and she distributes her products to different supermarkets in the city. Sra. Yrma has demonstrated that she is responsible and hardworking because of her entrepreneurial spirit. This is the only source of income that she has to cover her household expenses.

The loan being granted to Sra. Yrma will be used to buy supplies, such as flour and sugar in bulk, for the year-end season. She is very grateful to Emprender for trusting her and giving her the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Libia Maria

texts.es: Libia  es la propietaria de una peluquería en la ciudad de Cartagena , ella es casada y tiene un hijo en la edad de 12 años, con su negocio apoya la gestión de bienestar de su hogar y en él ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional, realizando tratamientos de cabellos, cepillado, manicure, pedicuro, actividades que desarrolla directamente en sus instalaciones y también a domicilio a clientes de su barrio y en toda la ciudad de Cartagena, mediante la modalidad de crédito y contado.  Su esperanza de crecimiento es inmensa,  porque trabaja permanentemente y hasta en horarios extendidos con el fin de lograr salir adelante. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales de consumos, como champo, cremas capilares, esmaltes en mayor volumen, para lograr descuentos que disminuyan sus costos y provisionarse para responder efectivamente,  a la época de mayor movimiento mercadológico del año. Así mismo comprara una silla de peluquería para que sus clientes estén cada día mas cómodos y disfruten del ambiente confortable, con el que ella sueña lograr.
texts.en:
Libia owns a beauty shop in the city of Cartagena.  She is married and has a 12 year old son.  Her business helps the well-being of her household.  

In her business she offers services to improve the personal and professional image.  She does hair treatments, blow-outs, manicures, and pedicures.  These services take place in her facilities and also at the houses of customers from the neighborhood and all around the city of Cartagena.  Her services are for cash and credit.

Her wish to grow is immense.  She works constantly and even in extended hours so that she can manage to get ahead.

This is exactly the reason that she turns to a Kiva loan.  This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy consumable products like shampoo, hair creams, and nail polish.  She will buy in greater volume in order to get discounts that reduce the cost.  She will also do this in order to have reserves to effectively respond to the season that has the greatest movement in the market of the year.  She will also buy a hair dresser’s chair so that every day her customers are more comfortable and enjoy the comfortable atmosphere that she dreams of achieving.

loans.use: to buy consumable products like shampoo, hair creams, and nail polish in greater volume and to buy a beautician's chair.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia, tiene 42 años de edad, casada desde hace 16 años, tienen 3 hijos de 10, 12 y 15 años de edad, quienes están estudiando, vive en una aldea de  San Manuel, Cortes. Su esposo trabaja en empresa privada en área de mantenimiento.

Ana Julia, una señora muy trabajadora, tiene 15 años de vender mercadería nueva como camisas, pantalones, jeans, blusas y trajes. Anteriormente, trabajaba en una empresa privada pero decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa porque obtiene mejores ingresos. 

Inicio su negocio con fondos propios, lleva  dos prestamos solicitados a ODEF para incrementar su inventario, con el préstamo actual va surtir mas de ropa como blusas, faldas, jeans, pantalones y ropa para niños. Ella vende en su casa y también de forma ambulante.

Su sueño es abrir una tienda en el mercado de  San Pedro Sula, donde incrementaría sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is 42 years old. She has been married since the age of 16. She has 3 kids that are 10, 12 and 15 years old who are in school. She lives in a neighborhood called San Manuel Cortes. Her husband works in maintenance for a private company  

Ana Julia is a very hard working woman. She has been selling clothing such as shirts, blouses, jeans and pants for 15 years. Before that she worked for a private company but decided to dedicate herself to selling clothing because she receives a better income. 

She began her business with her own capital. She has received two loans from ODEF to increase her business inventory. With this loan she will obtain more clothing such as blouses, skirts, jeans, pants and clothing for children. She sells from her home and also door to door. 

Her dream is to open a store in the market of San Pedro Sula where she could increase her sales.

loans.use: Buy new clothes for her store such as blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, jeans, and clothing for children.

loans.name: Marguérite

texts.fr:
Marguérite est une femme  âgé(e) de 48 ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et a 01 enfant. 
Marguérite travaille comme revendeuse des produits d’alimentations générale depuis 2008. Elle vend à domicile à ses clients après achat au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Marguérite a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentations générales.
Marguérite voudrait agrandir son activité en ajoutant la vente d’autres marchandise et assurer un avenir radieux à son enfant.
texts.en: Marguérite is  a 48-year-old woman.  She is married to a reseller and has one child.  Marguérite has been reselling grocery products since 2008.  She buys her products at the Grand Market of Lomé and delivers them directly to her customers.  Marguerite has requested a first loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products.  Marguerite would like to expand her business and sell new products.  She would like to make it possible for her child to enjoy a bright future.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos’s dream is to open his own furniture showroom. After moving to the US from his native Columbia, he worked for a company that builds and finishes all types of wood furniture, cabinets, floors, etc. Carlos fell in love with the job and decided to work for himself as a wood craftsman. He opened a carpentry business out of his home in Florida almost three years ago. Carlos is proud that he is able to support his family through his hard work while doing something he loves. He hopes this loan will enable him to expand by hiring employees, opening a store-front, and let him make a greater contribution to his community.

This loan from Accion USA will allow Carlos to build the credit history he needs in the United States in order to formalize his business. He then can take the necessary steps to move from his home to a store-front location. Carlos says this loan will help him to obtain the tools he needs to showcase his excellent work and access a greater number of clients.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry equipment.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La señora María dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que esta ubicado en su propio domicilio,  nacida en el departamento de Santa Cruz de la Sierra. La señora demuestra ser responsable y trabajadora con espíritu emprendedor ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar que esta conformado por sus dos hijas pequeñas. El crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra de mercadería como harina y azúcar, aceite en mayor cantidad por época de fin de año necesita surtir su tienda. La señora esta muy agradecida con emprender por confiar en ella y poder darle la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. María sells basic necessities out of the neighborhood store located in her home. She was born in the Department of Santa Cruz de La Sierra. Because of her entrepreneurial spirit, Sra. María has demonstrated that she is responsible and hardworking. This is the only source of income that enables her to meet the household expenses for her two young daughters.

The loan being granted to Sra. María will be used to buy merchandise such as flour, sugar, and oil in large quantities because she needs to restock her store for the year-end season. She is very grateful to Emprender for trusting her and giving her the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients, cooking utensils, and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes tiene 43 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Desde hace mas de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida, el precio de los productos que compra aumentan por lo que no puede comprar variedad en su mercadería. El motivo de la compra que solicita es para ofrecer calzado, cremas, perfumes, pulseras, aretes, cosméticos entre otros productos. Sueña con lograr incrementar su inventario y al mismo tiempo brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 43 years old and sells general merchandise. She has earned her living in this manner for more than 12 years. The prices of the products that she buys have increased, so she is not able to maintain a variety of merchandise.

The reason for this loan is so that she can offer shoes, crèmes, perfumes, bracelets, earrings, cosmetics, and other products. María dreams of increasing her inventory so that she can provide better service.

loans.use: to buy shoes, crèmes, perfumes, bracelets, earrings, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 24 ans. Elle est marié à un frigoriste et ont 01 enfant.
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générales depuis 2008. Elle vend dans une boutique après achat au Grand Marché de Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Akossiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des marchandises pour mieux répondre à la demande de la population en cette période des fêtes.
Akossiwa voudrait accroitre son bénéfice pour pouvoir bien répondre à la satisfaction de sa famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 24-year-old woman.  She is married to a refrigerating engineer and has one child.  Akossiwa has been reselling grocery products since 2008.  She purchases her products at the Grand Market of Lomé and sells them in a shop.  Her main difficulty is a drop in sales.  In order to buy products that will better meet customer demand during the Holidays, Akossiwa has requested her first loan from WAGES.  Akossiwa would like to increase her profits in order to fulfill her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy grocery products.

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es:
María Irene forma parte del Banco comunal “Ilusión y una Esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica a la confección y arreglos de ropa, desde hace dos años.
Comenta que de lunes a viernes, durante las mañanas trabaja de manera dependiente y durante las tardes se dedica a su negocio, a veces cuando no alcanza a entregar todos sus pedidos de confección trabaja los días sábados.
María arrienda un local que habilitó como un taller de confección, ahí cuenta con tres máquinas de coser; una máquina de coser con puntada recta, una máquina de coser overlock y una maquina bordadora. 
Sus clientes son diversos, desde personas particulares que solicitan algún arreglo en sus prendas, hasta empresas y colegios, en los cuales debe entregar ropa al por mayor.
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su negocio, entre hilos y género.
Las metas en su negocio son industrializarse, para esto necesitaría comprar nuevas maquinarias.
María vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 13, 11 y 6 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son independizarse, para esto su negocio debe ser sostenible en el tiempo.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. 
Comenta que con las capacitaciones ha aprendido a llevar la contabilidad de su negocio de mejor manera.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, se siente muy cómoda, ya que son unidos, responsables y programan actividades juntos. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
María Irene is a member of the Ilusión y una Esperanza communal bank in the city of Talca.  She has been making and altering clothes for two years.  She says that Monday through Friday she works as an employee during the mornings, and in the afternoons she devotes herself to her business.  At times, when she has not completed all of her sewing orders, she works on Saturdays.

María rents a place that she equipped as a sewing shop.  She has three sewing machines there; one machine to sew a straight stitch, one overlock sewing machine, and an embroidery machine.  She has diverse customers from private individuals who request alteration of their clothes to businesses and schools, where she needs to deliver the clothes wholesale.

She will use this loan to buy supplies like thread and material for her business.  Her goal for her business is to become industrialized.  In order to so she would need to buy new machines.

She lives with her husband and their three children; ages 13, 11, and 6.  Her personal dream is to become independent.  Her business needs to be sustainable over time for this to happen.

She is very content and grateful for the support given by Fondo Esperanza because it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She says that through the trainings she has learned to keep her business accounts in a better way.  In regards to her communal bank, she feels very comfortable because they are united, responsible, and schedule activities together.

Talca is located in Maule region in central Chile. It is the administrative, economic, and cultural hub of the region as well as the most important city in Chile’s Central Valley. There is a curious saying in Chile, the phrase “Talca, Paris, and London”. Among the many legends that explain the derivation of this phrase, some say it was originally spoken by an Englishman who said “Talca looks like London”, referring to the abundant fog that frequently covers the city during the winter season, similar to the British capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies like thread and fabric for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy artificial flowers and decorations

loans.name: Victor Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Víctor es soltero y tiene 31 años de edad, él actualmente vive en la ciudad de Ica en casa de su padre, se dedica al transporte público en un vehículo alquilado y gana S/.33 en promedio diariamente.

En estos últimos meses él se ha dedica a criar a sus sobrinos y a pagarles todo lo que ellos necesitan debido a que su hermana padece de cáncer y fue detectado desde hace ya un tiempo. Él desea el crédito para poder pagar algunos tratamientos que necesita su hermana para poder recuperarse. Su gran sueño es poder tener un auto propio que le permita generar mayores ingresos con la finalidad de ayudar mucho más a su hermana y también desea tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Victor is single and is 31 years old.  He currently lives in the city of Ica in his father's house.  He is a taxi driver in a rented vehicle.  He makes an average of 33 PEN per day.  

In the last few months he has been taking care of his nephews and paying for everything they need, because his sister suffers from cancer.  She was diagnosed some time ago.  He would like the loan to be able to pay for some treatments that his sister needs to recuperate.  

His big dream is to have his own vehicle which will allow him to generate a better income with the goal of helping his sister much more.  He also wishes to have his own house.

loans.use: to help his sister who has cancer.

loans.name: Edrahy

texts.es:
La señora Edrahy, tiene 30 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, su esposo es albañil, reside en una comunidad de Santa Elena en el Municipio de Quimistan, Santa Bárbara.
Doña Edrahy  se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de ropa nueva, cosméticos, sandalias y zapatos, inicio su negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante con su familia.
Ha tramitado un préstamo de 8900 Lempiras, los cuales invertirá  una parte en la compra de mercadería y  la otra parte para pago de escritura de un terreno en el que piensa construir en el futuro su vivienda y el local para su negocio.
Considera que las ganancias que obtiene son muy buenas, sintiéndose motivada a continuar con su negocio y poder brindarle la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Edrahy, 30, lives with her husband in a common law relationship; she has a 7-year-old son.  Her husband’s a bricklayer and she lives in the community of Santa Elena in Quimistan Municipality, Santa Bárbara.  For the last two years she’s been selling new clothes, cosmetics, sandals and shoes.  She started the business because she needed to get ahead with her family.

She has negotiated an 8900 Lempiras loan that she will invest part of in the purchase of merchandise and the other part to pay for the title on a piece of property that she plans to build her future home on as well as the locale for her business.  She considers that the profits she earns are very good so she’s motivated to stay in business and be able to provide an education for her son.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to pay for property title.

loans.name: Alma Marisol

texts.es: Alma, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de incrementar su negocio, invirtiéndolo en variedad de ropa y cosméticos, blusas, falsas, ropa interior, crema, Lociones, para mejorar ventas y la atención a los clientes. El efecto de los préstamos anteriores en el negocio de Alma fortaleció la mercadería y le dio una mejor capacidad de respuesta a las demandas de los clientes, con ello mejoró sus ingresos y la disponibilidad económica para cualquier gasto familiar; su familia está mejorando, sus hijos han avanzado en el estudio y ella se encuentra contenta y agradecida por este apoyo.
texts.en: Alma decided to request a loan because she needed to expand her business, by investing in a variety of clothing, cosmetics, blouses, skirts, undergarments, creams, and lotions, to improve her sales and customer service.  The previous loans have helped strengthen Alma’s business, gave it more merchandise, and gave it a better ability to serve customer needs.  This allowed her to increase her income and financial availability for any family expense.  Her family is improving her children are advancing in their studies, and she is happy and grateful for this support.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo ya que necesita comprar dos llantas y repuestos para su vehículo de uso empresarial (taxi), él se decidió por la buena atención de la institución y por la necesidad de dar a su vehículo el mantenimiento adecuado.
Los efectos que Carlos ha tenido con los préstamos ha sido favorable ya que le ha permitido mantenerse y apoyar a su familia de una mejor manera, este avance le ha permitido la decisión de adquirir su propia vivienda con el fondo social, aunque por el momento no la habita porque todavía falta los servicios públicos como agua, luz y teléfono.
texts.en:
Carlos is asking for a new loan because he needs to buy two tires and repair parts for his vehicle that he uses in an entrepreneurial way (as a taxi).  He decided to do this because of the attention he got from the institution and out of need to give his vehicle some needed maintenance.

The effects of the loans have been favorable for Carlos and they have allowed him to support his family in a better way and acquire his own home with public funds.  He still does not live there because running water, electricity, and telephone services have not been installed.

loans.use: to maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline de 29 años, vive en Puerto Colombia, municipio ubicado a orillas del mar caribe, con su esposo y alimentando en familia sus sueños de crecimiento y prosperidad futura, mediante su negocio de piñatería, ubicado en el centro de esta población; desde que Jaqueline inauguró su negocio, este  ha tenido una gran acogida por los habitantes porteños, debido a que su fortaleza es la capacidad de promoción de su propietaria y porque es uno de los pocos almacenes de piñatería que existen en Puerto Colombia, donde además,  los clientes  encuentran  bolsas de regalos, útiles escolares, de papelería, globos, desechables , piñatas infantiles,  recordatorios  etc. Su meta de crecimiento empresarial no se detiene y esta es la razón por la cual desea aumentar su capital de trabajo mediante los credikiva, por eso está aplicando al primero, que es también el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará juguetes, útiles escolares, para atender dos temporadas que vienen y usualmente las ventas se incrementan sustancialmente y ella debe estar preparada para responder a las necesidades, deseos e intereses de sus clientes reales y potenciales. Así mismo su meta es lograr construír condiciones excepcionales de bienestar, para que cuando su hijo, en camino,  llegue a su hogar fortalezca la felicidad que hoy reina en su familia.
texts.en: Jaqueline is 29 years old and she and her husband live in Puerto Colombia, a city located along the Caribbean Sea.  Together they feed her dreams of growth and a prosperous life through her piñata business, located in the population center.  Jaqueline’s business has been welcomed by the port residents ever since she began it.  Its strength is in her ability to promote it and because there are only a few piñata businesses in Puerto Colombia.  In her shop her customers can also find gift bags, school supples, paper goods, balloons, disposable items, children’s piñatas, souvenirs, etc.  Her goal of growing her business does not stop and this is why she wants to increase her working capital through a Kiva loan, and she is applying for her first loan though Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the money to buy toys and school supplies to stock up for two upcoming seasons when her sales increase substantially and she needs to be prepared to respond to her customers’ current and potential needs, wants, and interests.  Another goal is to create exceptional conditions of well-being so that her son will be happy when he is at home and also strengthen the happiness that reigns in the family.

loans.use: to buy tows and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition for a marketing course.

loans.name: Residenciales El Campo N° 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Residenciales El Campo #2 está integrado por tres socias, los cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas. Doña Elbia es una las socias, tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos. De lunes a viernes, ella tiene un empleo fijo como aseadora y el fin de semana vende verduras. El problema más difícil que enfrenta es que no tiene una vivienda propia, y los directivos de la escuela le dieron permiso para que construyera una habitación dentro de las instalaciones de la misma y gracias a los préstamos obtenidos en FAMA pudo hacerlo, aunque la habitacion es muy pequeña para su familia. Su reto es ahorrar aunque sea de poco en poco para comprar un solar y poder construir su casa, seguir manteniendo a su familia porque hace dos años su esposo murió y no tiene ningún otro soporte económico. Elbia solicita el préstamo para comprar papas, chiles, cebollas, zanahorias, pataste, repollo, coliflor, brocoli, entre otras verduras. y así ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Una de sus ventajas es que su hijo mayor le ayuda a transportar en una carreta las verduras desde la escuela hasta el mayoreo y no tiene que pagar transporte ni empleado porque él también le ayuda a atender a los clientes. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera obtener mejores ganancias para ahorrar un poco, seguir llevando el alimento a su casa y seguir pagando el estudio de sus cuatro hijos menores. Su sueño es tener también un puesto de venta de ropa para contar con otra entrada de dinero y así poder empezar a construir su casa, y graduar a sus hijos. Elbia se siente muy agradecida porque con el financiamiento obtenido en FAMA ha podido mejorar sus condiciones económicas y de antemano se siente agradecida con todas las personas que invertirán en ella a través del préstamo.
texts.en:
The united group called, “Residenciales El Campo #2” is made up of three members who run different businesses.  Elbia is one of the members.  She’s 51 years old, a widow, and has five children.  She has a steady job as a school advisor from Monday to Friday and sells vegetables on the weekends.  Her biggest problem is that she doesn’t have her own home and the school managers have allowed her to set up living quarters within the school.  Thanks to the loans she’s gotten through FAMA, she’s been able to set it up, although it’s too small for her family.

It’s a challenge for her to save money, but she’s saving a little at a time to buy a lot on which to build, while continuing to support her family.  Her husband died two years ago and she has no other means of financial support.

Elbia is asking for this loan in order to buy potatoes, peppers, onions, carrots, chayote squash, cauliflower, broccoli, and other vegetables, so that she can offer the greatest variety of products to her customers.  One of her advantages is that her oldest son helps her transport her vegetables from the school to the marker in his cart, so she doesn’t have to pay for transportation or for an employee because he also helps to serve the customers.

With the support of this loan, she hopes to increase her income to be able to save a bit, continue feeding her family, and continue paying for her four youngest children’s school expenses.  Her dream is to also have a place to sell clothing so that she can have another source of income and be able to build her house and graduate her children.

Elbia feels very grateful because this loan she obtained through FAMA has allowed her to improve her financial situation.  She is grateful to all the people who will invest in her through this loan.
.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Olga Leonor

texts.es: Olga de 22 años y madre de un niño de 13 meses es la propietaria de un negocio donde ofrece el servicio de fotocopiaje, impresiones, transcripciones y laminación ubicado en el lugar donde habita. Su idea emprendedora nació después de recibir su liquidación de la empresa de donde ella era empleada y tradujo está en la inversión de su fotocopiadora y gradualmente agregó más de estas y equipos que compró a crédito y que con las utilidades producidas por su negocio logró terminar de pagar.  Su sueño de crecimiento está siempre latente y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, pues quiere invertir en una época en la que se augura un alto movimiento comercial., como lo es el final del año, debido a las fiestas navideñas y de cierre del año. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que recibe de la fundación Mario Santo Domingo comprará 2 computadores para adicionar el servicio de internet que es muy solicitado y ella desea integrar a un mercado joven que lo amerita y con ello hacer del esta inversión todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Olga is 22 years old and the mother of a 13 month old son.  She has a business where she provides photocopy services, printing, transcriptions, and laminations.  It’s located in her home.  Her entrepreneurial idea came to her when she received her severance from the company she used to work for.  She began with a single photocopier, and gradually added more of these and other equipment that she bought on credit and was able to pay off with the profits from her business.

Her dream to grow is always present and for this reason she is asking for a Kiva loan.  She wants to invest during a season where there is lots of business, like year’s end, because of Christmas and new year.

She will use the money from this Kiva loan, her first one through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy computers to add internet service, which is often requested.  She wants to enter a younger market and in this way make her investment a success.

loans.use: to buy computers to add internet service to her photocopy business

loans.name: Dora Irma

texts.es:
La señora Dora Irma es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que actualmente están estudiando su hija la mayor esta por terminar la universidad y su hijo esta estudiando la preparatoria desea que sus hijos tengan la mejor educación. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos de la universidad de su hija ya que en este año termina su carrera profesional. 
Doña Dora Irma es originaria de la ciudad de Zacatecas, ya tiene años radicando en Nuevo Laredo su propósito es que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro. Dora Irma trabaja como vendedora de teléfonos móvil en toda la ciudad y con este ingreso ha salido a delante.
texts.en:
Dora Irma is a single mother and has two children who attend school.  Her oldest daughter is about to graduate from university and her son is in high school.  She wants her children to have the best education.

This is why she’s asking for this loan; so that she can pay her daughter’s university expenses, especially now that she will finish her studies this year.

Dora Irma is originally from Zacatecas and has been living in Nuevo Laredo for years.  She wanted her children to have a better future.  Dora Irma sells mobile telephones all over the city and has gotten ahead with this income.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepcion, esta decidida por un nuevo prestamo, este nuevo tramite es para utilizarlo en la compra de mesas y sillas plasticas, tambien gaseosas, para el negocio que hoy en dia administra, ella se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios por la temporada que se acerca.
Ella esta contenta por que el primer prestamo le ayudo a cubrir un gasto personal el cual era de mucha importancia.
texts.en:
Concepcion decided to ask for a new loan to buy plastic tables and chairs, and also soft drinks for the business she manages.  She sells food for the upcoming season.

She is happy because the first loan helped her cover a very important personal expense.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.es: Martha  de 21 años vive con su hijo de 2,  en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar ubicado a orillas del mar donde tradicionalmente habitan extranjeros poetas, artistas que se inspiran en este lugar. Marta es la propietaria  de una miscelánea donde vende regalos, tarjetas piñatería perfumes y variedades femeninas y para el hogar que son una necesidad de los habitantes de esta población. Su negocio se divide en dos locales en una está su miscelánea y en el otro un café internet donde ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje, fax, telefonía celular y llamadas locales e internacionales.  Su negocio funciona desde hace 4 años y sus ventas siempre se han mantenido con una tendencia creciente, porque además es un punto de recaudo un banco, donde puede pagar su cuota de préstamo y de servicios públicos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprara ropa, juguetería porque son las mercancías de mayor salida en el fin de año lleno de fiestas y alegría familiar, donde usualmente se incrementan sus venta y lograría él éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Marta is 21 years old and lives with her two year old son in Puerto Colombia, located along the sea, where foreign poets and artists live and are inspired.  Marta owns a boutique where she sells gifts, cards, piñatas, perfumes, feminine items, and things that people need around the house.

Her business is divided into two locations; one is the boutique and the other is an internet café, where she provides photocopy, fax, cell phone, and local and international calling services.  She’s been in business for four years and it’s been growing, because she also offers bill paying services and people can go there to pay on their bank loans or utilities.

This Kiva loan will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy clothing and toys because these are the things that sell best at the end of the year, which is full of parties and family glee.  Sales usually go up and this will make her investment successful.

loans.use: to buy clothing and toys.

loans.name: Scarleth Elizabeth

texts.es: Scarleth actualmente se encuentra cursando el último año de su carrera de Derecho, el crédito solicitado es para el pago del curso de finalización, y de ésta manera poder optar a tener su título. Scarleth está trabajando y de esa forma paga sus estudios. Dentro de algunos años se mira trabajando como asesor legal en una empresa del estado. Su inspiración es su madre, espera que se pueda sentir orgullosa. Le inspira también su deseo de superación personal.
texts.en: Scarleth is in her final year of law school and she is asking for this loan to pay for her final course and be able to obtain her title.  She works and in this way pays her tuition.  She sees herself working as a corporate legal advisor in her state in a few years.  Her mother is her inspiration and she hopes that she’s proud of her.  Her personal desire to succeed also inspires her.

loans.use: law school tuition

loans.name: Ana Yesenia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, este negocio lo tiene desde hace un año, lo hace por medio de revistas de AVON, ESIKA, y otras que le dan la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos, ella visita casa por casa ofreciendo los productos, este negocio lo inicio por necesidad para ayudar a su esposo y tener una mejor solvencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos de revista: maquillaje, lápiz de ojo, labiales, lociones, también comprara ropa, blusas, faldas, pantalones, para tener en esta temporada que se acerca de navidad, o si fuese mejor alcanzar a venderlas en este tiempo antes de que llegue la fecha.
Los sueños de Ana son que con el negocio logre crecer, poder mejorar la vivienda de las ganancias que obtenga y por medio de los préstamos estabilice su situación.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband.  They do not have any children.  Ana's business is selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for one year.  She makes her sales through AVON, ESIKA and other catalogs.  These give her the opportunity to make her own income.  She makes her sales door to door, offering her products.  She started her business through necessity, in order to help her husband and improve their financial situation.  

Ana is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics: makeup, eyeliner, lipsticks and lotions.  She will also buy clothes, blouses, skirts and pants so that she has products available during the Christmas season.  She would like to sell her produce before Christmas.  

Ana's dreams are to grow her business and improve her home with the profits that she makes.  Through her loans, she plans to stabilize her situation.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, make-up, eyeliner, lipsticks and lotions

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia, tiene 35 años, tiene 3 hijos de 4, 8 y 10 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su madre y una hermana en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.
Doña Lidia  se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva de manera ambulatoria desde hace 13 años, destinando los tiempos libres de los días de lunes a sábado. Ella inicio su negocio motivada por su familia y a la necesidad de brindarles seguridad alimentaria y  educación a sus hijos. 
Actualmente ha tramitado un préstamo de 5000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños (pantalones, camisas, blusas, fajas y zapatos) y venderla en la temporada navideña.
Ella espera invertir sus ganancias para tener su propio local en el futuro y apoyar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Lida is 35 years old with 3 children that are 4, 8 and 10 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her mother and a sister in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. 

Lidia has been selling clothing door to door for 13 years during her free time on Mondays - Saturdays. She was motivated to start her business because of her family and the need to give her children food security and education. 

She is currently requesting a loan of 5000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of clothing for women, men and children (pants, shirts, blouses and shoes) to sell during the Christmas season.

She hopes to invest her profits to put up her own store in the future and support her children with their education.

loans.use: buy clothing for men, women and children

loans.name: Duo Bendicion Del Campo Group

texts.es:
DUO  BENDICION DEL CAMPO
Este grupo está formado doña Sonia Yanira de 48 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, y es vendedora de ropa de bebe, desde hace 6 años, nos cuenta que solicita este crédito para poder incrementar su venta ya que en esta época navideña la ropa de bebe es muy solicitada, también esta doña Blanca de 51 años de edad, ella es casada, y tiene 4 hijos,la lider del grupo y es dueña de una panadería desde hace 8 años, nos cuenta que esta solicitando este crédito para poder comprar harina de pan,  leña y algunos otros materiales para la elaboración del pan, ya que en este tiempo, los pedidos de pan se incrementan por motivo de las fiestas navideñas, entonces los clientes encargan pan, tortas y algunos otros panes de la época y por lo tanto necesitan arina, y solo en este tiempo pueden comprar material a buen precio de lo contrario se eleva el precio o ya no pueden conseguir por lo tanto esperan que se les pueda otorgar este crédito ya ellas lo están necesitando y esperan cumplir con todos los pagos que sean requeridos.
texts.en:
DUO BENDICION DEL CAMPO

One member of the duo is Sonia Yanira who is 48 years old, married and has 2 children. She has been selling baby clothing for the past 6 years. She tells us that she asks for this loan to be able to increase her sales, as during the Christmas season baby clothing is very sought after. 

Also in the duo is Blanca who is 51 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She is the group leader and has been the owner of a bakery for the past 8 years. She tells us that she is asking for this loan to be able to buy flour, firewood and some other materials for preparing bread, as at this time of year bread orders increase due to the Christmas celebrations. At this time of year her customers order bread, cakes and other seasonal breads and due to this she needs flour, which she can only buy at a good price now, otherwise it is impossible to meet the price increases. Therefore, they hope that they are conceded this loan as they need it and they hope to comply with all the payments required.

loans.use: to buy flour and firewood for the preparation of bread.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo cuenta con apenas dos años con esta actividad que es le elaboración del carbón, también de dedica al oficio de albañil y su esposos para ayudarlo en la economía y gastos escolares de sus dos hijos, se dedica a la elaboración y reparación de ropa (Costura). 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar la materia prima que es leña para la elaboración del carbón, en esta temporada de invierno es cuando tiene mas pedidos y desea invertir, para obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Guillermo has been making charcoal for just two years.  He also works as a builder and his wife, in order to help with their finances and their children's education expenses, works making and repairing clothes (sewing).
