Es por ello que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima: como colonias, cremas, calzado, toallas, reloj, ropa en general, prendas de plata y oro laminado entre otros productos demandados.
texts.en: María Inés is 55 years old and sells general merchandise.  Her business offers a great variety of products that her customers are looking for.  She started this economic venture with her own capital in order to generate income for her family.  She sells on foot in places where she offers her merchandise.  One of her dreams is to continue working so that she can maintain her credit level with the foundation, as this is not her fist experience with it.  She is asking for this loan to buy supplies, like colognes, creams, shoes, towels, watches, clothing, and gold and silver jewelry among other things that her customers demand.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: María Olgita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
En este lugar conocimos a La señora María, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual procreo 8 hijos que en la actualidad ya todos son mayores e independientes. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales, exotéricos y medicinales, tiene un puesto en el centro de la ciudad, sitio donde vende todos estos productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 19h00 y lo que más vende son productos medicinales para los riñones y el hígado, tiene productos de muchas marcas los mismos que recibe en su local. Lleva más de 20 años dedicada al comercio.

Este crédito es para comprar inciensos, medicinas y otros productos naturales que ella vende. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local más grande y de su propiedad ya que el que tiene es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the “Emprendedora De Los Cerezos” communal bank meet every two weeks in the town of Los Cerezos.  This zone is urban very populated.

María is 54 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has eight adult children who are all on their own.  Her life partner is a merchant.

Aside from her being a great house keeper, she also sells natural products, both exotic and medicinal.  She has a point of sale in the city center, where she sells all of her products.  She works every day from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm and her medicinal products for the kidneys and liver are her best sellers.  She carries many different brands and has been in business for 20 years.

She will use the money from this loan to buy incense, medicines and other natural products she sells.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys it because the loans have been of great help.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Gina Maritza

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
Aquí conversamos con la señora Gina, ella tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos dos mayores de edad y el menor de  8 años que es el que  vive con ella y estudia en escuela.

Ella es una muy buena madre que para que a sus hijos nunca les faltara nada se dedica al duro trabajo para sacarlos adelante,  ella trabaja en una casa haciendo los quehaceres domésticos, pero en las noches y en los días libres se dedica al comercio, e vende productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios), visita a sus clientes los sabados y domingos en el día ya que en estos días cobra porque deja a crédito. Lo que más vende son los perfumes, lleva en este negocio por más de 8 años y gracias a esto ha podido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y bisutería. Lleva en el Banco Comunal por seis  años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

 Sus sueños son tener un bazar y seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
Emprendedora de Los Cerezos Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the residential area of Los Cerezos, in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a poor and very densely populated urban area.

Here we spoke with Gina.  She is 42 years old and the single mother of three children.  Two are adults and the youngest, age 8, lives with her and attends school.

She is a very good mother who works hard to get her children ahead so they will never lack anything.  She works in a house doing domestic chores, but at night and on her days off she works in business, selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories).  She visits her customers on Saturdays and Sundays during the day, since those days she collects her money because she sells on credit.  What she sells most is perfume.  She has had this business for more than eight years and thanks to this she has been able to get ahead.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry.  She has been with the communal bank for six years and she likes it because of the help they give with the loans.

Her dreams are to have a store and to get ahead in life and in her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Jenni Marisol

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
En este lugar conocimos a Jenni, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 12 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido trabaja en un bus de transporte de la localidad.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende  productos Avon (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella sale a recorrer por su localidad los tres últimos días de la semana, ya que en esos días ella consigue a todos sus clientes en sus casas y es más fácil vender sus productos, además en esos días cobra ya  deja sus productos a crédito. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le encanta lo que hace ya así conoce muchas personas.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar perfumes, cremas, y bisutería más que todo los de oferta ya que luego los vende al precio normal y así le queda más ganancias. Lleva más de 4 años en el  Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The "Emprendedora De Los Cerezos" ["Entrepreneur of Los Cerezos"] communal bank meets twice a month in the Los Cerezos area of the city of Portoviejo. This is a highly populated area on the edge of the city.

This is where we meet Jenni.  She is 42 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has four children.  Two are adults, while the two aged 12 and 10 years attend school.  Her husband works in bus transportation in the area.

Jenni is a great housewife who also works in retail selling Avon products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and accessories, among other things).  Her sales approach is going door-to-door and on request.  She travels her area the last three days of the week, as on these days she can find all her customers at home, and it is much easier to sell her products.  It is also on these days that she collects payment and delivers products that have been bought on credit.  She has been doing this work for four years, and she loves what she does as she has gotten to know many people this way.  

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry mostly for her supply, so she can sell them later at the regular price and so make more profits.

She has been in the communal bank for more than four years, and is the president of the bank.  She likes it because of the benefits that the institution provides.

Her dream is to give nothing but the best to her young children.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ramona Benita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ramona, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos todos mayores  de edad, el menor aun vive en su casa. Su marido es chofer de una volqueta.

Ella además de ser una gran madre y ama de casa para ganarse algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, vende gas de uso doméstico, para lo cual tiene un local en su casa, pero además de esto también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y en su casa donde vende el gas, deja a crédito estos productos  y cobra cada fin de semana,  lleva más de tres años en este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y gas de uso doméstico. Este es su sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les da la institución.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The Emprendedora de Los Cerezos communal bank meets every two weeks in the Los Cerezos residential community of the city of Portoviejo. This is a densely populated marginal urban area.

In this place we meet Ramona, 50 years old. She lives with her partner, with whom she has three children, who are all adults. The youngest still lives in her house. Her partner is a dump truck driver.

In addition to being a great mother and housewife, she also has a business in order to earn something herself. She sells household gas, for which she has a store in her house, but besides that she also sells Avon products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and accessories, among other things). She sells door-to-door and in her house where she sells the gas. She sells these products on credit and collects every weekend. She has been in this business for more than three years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, and household gas cylinders. This is her sixth cycle with the communal bank, and she likes the bank because of the help it gives the members.

Her dreams are to move forward with her business and her personal life.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, and household gas

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
En este lugar conocimos a María, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos de 7, 4 y 1 año  de edad, dos de ellos estudian en escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Yanbal y Avon (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella sale a recorrer por su localidad dos o tres días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esta hora sus hijos están en la escuela ya que en la tarde tiene que dedicarse a sus hijos ayudándoles en sus tareas que les dejan en la escuela. Ella  deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra cada 8 días, lleva un año en este negocio y empezó con su primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar perfumes, cremas y bisutería. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos ya que con ellos puede financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
The "Emprendedora De Los Cerezos" ["Entrepreneur of Los Cerezos"] communal bank meets twice a month in the Los Cerezos area of the city of Portoviejo. This is a highly populated area on the edge of the city.

This is where we meet María. She is 25 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has three children, aged 7, 4 and 1 year. Two of them attend school. Her husband works in construction.

Jenni is a great mother and housewife who also works in retail selling Yanbal and Avon products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and accessories, among other things). Her sales approach is going door-to-door and on request. She travels her area two or three days a week. mainly in the mornings as this is when her children are in school, and in the afternoon she looks after her children, helping them with their homework.  She sells her products on credit, and collects on a weekly basis.  She has been doing this work for one year, and began it with the first loan that she received from the bank.

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry.  This is her fourth loan with the communal bank, and she likes it because of the loans with which she can finance her business.

Her dream is to continue increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: La Sra. Martina, es  una persona  trabajadora  y  muy  responsable, ella  tiene una  tienda  de  abarrotes en  su  domicilio el  cual le  ha permitido  sacar  adelante  a  su   hijo brindándole  la oportunidad  de  estudiar, es  por  ello   que  necesita  de  nuestra   ayuda  para construir   el  techo  de  madera  en su  casa para de esta  manera  extender  su negocio  y  contar  con la posibilidad  de  hacerlo crecer, agradece el  apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  proyecto.
texts.en: Señora Martina is a hard-working and very responsible person.  She has a grocery store in her home, which allows her to move her son ahead in life, providing him the opportunity to attend school.  It is for this reason that she needs our help, to put a wooden roof on her home so that she can extend her business space and have the possibility to grow her business.  She is grateful for the support being provided for realizing this plan.

loans.use: to make her business larger by building a new wooden roof.

loans.name: Enita Estrella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.

La señora Enita es socia fundadora del Banco comunal,  es la secretaria y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, la mayor de ellos aun vive con ella y estudia en universidad. Su esposo ya no trabaja por enfermedad. Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia en Portoviejo.

Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su casa para que les realice sus obras. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, su hija le ayuda cuando está desocupada. Lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta actividad.

Ella está  repitiendo el crédito ya que con los que ha recibido ha podido mejorar su negocio, con lo que le ha quedado de ganancia ella ha comprado otra máquina para realizar bordados y con esto ha tenido más trabajo y más clientes complacidos.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura ya que en esta época del año aumenta su trabajo. 

Su sueño es tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The members of 5 de Julio Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos [City of the Royal Tamarinds, a type of tree]. 

Enita is a founding member of the communal bank as well as the secretary, and she likes the bank because of the help they give with loans.  She is 52  years old and married, and has five children from this relationship, all of whom are grown. The oldest daughter still lives with her and studies at the university. Her husband no longer works due to illness. Several years ago she learned clothing cutting and assembling at an academy in Portoviejo.

She has a small sewing workshop in her house where for many years she has been sewing clothing.  She works on order from private individuals who come to her house so she can make their clothes. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m., and sometimes until later when she has orders to complete. Her daughter helps her when she is free. She has been doing this work for more than 20 years. 

She is repeating the loan because she has been able to improve her business with what she has received.  With the profit she has bought another machine to do embroidery, and with this she has had more work and more happy customers.

She is going to use this new loan to purchase cloth, thread, buttons, and other sewing supplies because at this time of year her work increases.

Her dream is to have a larger workshop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, buttons, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
For many years, Joel made a living by selling crafts in Mexico, so when he moved to California he continued to rely on his entrepreneurial spirit.  Joel started a new business, Joel’s Varios, where he sells an array of electronics.

“Joel’s Varios” earned a spot in Fruitvale’s bustling flea market, in a sea of very small business owners offering everything from hair adornments to licorice.  “It’s great being my own boss. Sometimes it’s hard, but it’s worth it,” Joel says. Several days a week, Joel offers a warm hello to passersby as he stands behind his electronics booth. A talented and driven salesman, Joel shares anecdotes about the gadgets with his customers as they pick through the large quantity of cameras, phones and radios he offers. 

But as Joel’s business expands, he needs to be able to expedite the process of transferring the electronics from his house to the flea market. With a loan of $7,500, he will purchase a van that will allow him to buy more electronics so that he can carry an even larger inventory, allowing him to earn greater profits.

loans.use: to buy a van to transport electronics to the flea market.

loans.name: Antonia Leticia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Antonia,  tiene 31 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela y el más pequeño en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es mecánico. Ella hace unos años estudio belleza en una Academia de la localidad.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ganar sus propios recursos se dedica a realizar trabajos de belleza, realiza todo tipo de trabajos como cortes de cabello, tinturados, manicure, pedicura, entre otros trabajos, trabaja todos los días y a las horas que sus clientes requieran de sus servicios, ella realiza sus trabajos tanto en su casa como a domicilio. Son seis años que viene dedicada a esta actividad y nunca le ha faltado trabajo en estos años.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, esmaltes y tigueras, cepillos, peinillas, etc. que necesita para ir aumentando sus servicios. Esta desde el inicio que se creó el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido de mucho para ir comprando sus herramientas y con esto mejorar sus ingresos.

Su sueño es tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The members of the 5 de Junio Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as City of the Royal Tamarinds. 

Here we meet Sra. Antonia, 31, who is married and has two sons, 9 and 4. The older one studies at school and the younger is in kindergarten. Her husband is a mechanic. Several years ago she took a beauty course in a local academy.

Antonia is a housewife who, in order to earn her own funds, offers beauty services. She does all kinds of work such as hair cutting, coloring, manicures and pedicures among others. She works every day and at the times when clients require her services. She works in their homes as well as in her own. She has been doing this job for six years and she has never lacked work during this time.

She will use this loan to purchase tints, nail polish, scissors, hairbrushes, combs, etc that she needs to continue expanding her services. She has been a member of the communal bank since its inception and is its treasurer. She enjoys it because the loans have enabled her buy her tools and with them to improve her earnings.

Her dream is to have a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy tints, nail polish, scissors, hairbrushes, combs, etc.

loans.name: Glende Fabricio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.

En este lugar conocimos al Señor Glende, tiene 33 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos de 7, 6 y un año y seis meses el último, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su mujer es ama de casa.

Él para ganarse el sustento diario y el  de su familia se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y sabanas, Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, el sale a recorrer todos los  días de la semana y los fines de semana también se desplaza a otros cantones para realizar sus ventas, deja  sus productos a crédito y cobra por cada 8 días, su mercadería la va a comprar cada vez que necesita a Guayaquil ya que según el allá le sale más barata,  lleva más de seis años en este negocio y gracias a él ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa de todo tipo y sabanas. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que le han brindado en el Banco para recibir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para ir a realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The members of the 5 de Junio Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as City of the Royal Tamarinds.
 
Here we meet Sr. Glende, 33, who is in a common law marriage from which he has three children, ages 7, 6 and 1 1/2 years old. The older children are in school and his wife is a homemaker.

He makes a daily living for himself and his family by selling all kinds of clothing and bed sheets. He sells from door to door and takes orders. He sets out every day of the week and on weekends he travels to other districts to make his sales. He sells on credit and collects every eight days. He goes to purchase merchandise any time he needs it in Guayaquil where he says he can obtain it cheaper. He has had his business for six years and with it he has been able to move his family ahead.

He will use this loan to buy all kinds of clothing and bed sheets. He has been with the communal bank through two loan cycles and he enjoys it because of the opportunity the bank has provided him to get loans. 

His dream is to have a car so he can drive his sales routes.

loans.use: to buy clothing and bed sheets.

loans.name: Agueda Candelaria

texts.es:
En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita en Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a La señora Agueda, tiene 55 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene seis hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive un nieto de 10 años que es como su hijo y que estudia en escuela. El esposo ya no trabaja es jubilado.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa, trabaja  todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, vende de todo desde productos de primera necesidad hasta artículos de papelería y bazar, además de  tarjetas telefónicas entre otras cosas, trabaja con la ayuda de su nieto y su esposo cuando él puede, sus productos compra en Portoviejo. Lleva con su tienda por más de 18 años y  es su forma de ganarse la vida. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos de primera necesidad, artículos de papelería y tarjetas telefónicas para surtir más su tienda. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque no piden tantos papeles para realizar los créditos. 

Sus sueños son ver que su nieto sea un buen profesional y seguir creciendo cada día más en su negocio.
texts.en:
The 6 de Julio Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Los Arenales in Crucita Parish in Portoviejo. The place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequently visited by tourists from within the country and abroad. The region has many beautiful locales and a rich variety of typical dishes. 

Here we meet Sra. Agueda, 55, who has a common law partner and six adult children. A 10 year old grandson lives with her. He is in school and is like a son to her. Her husband is retired and does not work.

She has a store in her house and works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. She sells everything, from essential goods to stationary supplies, as well as telephone cards among other things. She runs her store with the help of her grandson and her husband, when he is able. She buys her products in Portoviejo. She has had her store for more than 18 years and it is her way of making a living.

She will use this loan to purchase basic supplies, stationery and telephone cards to stock her store. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys it because it does not require a lot of paperwork to take out loans.

Her dreams are to see her grandson become a good professional and to continue seeing her business expand.

loans.use: to buy essential goods, stationery supplies and telephone cards.

loans.name: Sonia Agustina

texts.es:
En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita en Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 22, 20, 17 y 15 años, el menor estudia en colegio y los dos menores aun viven en su casa. El marido se dedica a la pesca. 

Ella además de ser una muy buena ama de casa, para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a realizar venta y limpieza de filetes de pescado, va en la mañana hasta las playas para comprar el mejor pescado para luego limpiarlo  y filetearlo para llevarlo a vender por toda la localidad o entregar a otros comerciantes que los llevan a otras ciudades. Lleva más de 4 años en este negocio y es así como ella puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para vender a sus clientes lo mejor. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a otras instituciones de crédito.

Su sueño es tener otra  lancha para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The “6 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks in Los Arenales in Crucita Parish in Portoviejo.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular with national and international tourists alike; it offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of dishes that are typical of the region.

Sonia, 42, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 22, 20, 17 and 15 years of age.  The youngest is in secondary school and the two youngest still live at home.  Her husband is a fisherman.

In addition to being a very good housewife, in order to obtain her own resources she decided to clean and filet fish.  In the morning she heads out to the beaches to buy the best fish and then clean it and filet it to take to sell throughout the community or to other merchants who take it to other cities.  She’s been in business over four years and this is how she helps her husband with household expenses.

This loan is to buy fish to sell to her customers the best.  She’s been in four cycles in the communal bank and she likes it because the interest rates are very low in comparison to other lending institutions.  Her dream is to have another boat so that her husband can do his fishing.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Lidia Mariana

texts.es:
En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita en Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lidia, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, el menor aun vive con ella y estudian en Universidad. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el cual se dedica a la agricultura,  este crédito es para prepara la tierra en la que esperan sembrar sus cultivos de maíz, maní y verduras ya que el invierno se acerca y es en esa temporada cuando ellos pueden cultivar estos productos. Su marido junto a sus hijos se dedican a este trabajo mientras que ella en su casa se dedica además a la cría de animales.

Este crédito es para comprar semillas y para pagar el sueldo de la gente que le ayuda en el trabajo que se está realizando. Lleva cuatro años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado con los créditos que ha recibido. 

Su sueño es que este año la cosecha sea muy buena.
texts.en:
The “6 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks in Los Arenales in Crucita Parish in Portoviejo.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular with national and international tourists alike; it offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of dishes that are typical of the region.

We met Lidia, 56, here.  She’s married and has four adult children although the youngest one still lives with her and goes to university.  Her husband’s a farmer.

She is taking out the loan to help her husband who is a farmer.  This loan is to prepare the soil in which they hope to plant corn, peanuts and vegetables because winter is approaching and that’s the season when those crops need to be planted.  Her husband and her children do this work while she stays home and raises animals.

This loan is to buy seeds and to pay wages to the people who will help with the work being done.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because they’ve always helped her with the loans she’s received.  Her dream is that this year the harvest is very good.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay wages.

loans.name: Nemfa

texts.en:
Nemfa is from Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, ZDS, Philippines. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. 

To earn a living, Nemfa runs a general store, selling a variety of food and household products such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo and soaps to members of the local community. Nemfa has been in business for over 26 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Nemfa is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Nemfa joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services to help improve both her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang is 42 years old.  She is widowed and lives with four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She raises ducks to produce eggs to sell. Neang requests a loan of $1,000 to purchase duck feed to feed the ducks in order to produce eggs faster to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to support her children while they study to earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase duck feed to speed up egg production.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Through patience and hard work, Gloria has been in her business for almost 26 years now. She is 60 years old and has only child. After doing the household chores, she finds her time to manages her beauty salon business by providing services like rebonds, relaxers, hot oils and she also sells accessories and Avon products. Despite competitors in the area, she can still manage the business. She has utilized her income for their basic necessities and for the education of her child.

With her interest to improve the business, Gloria is asking for an additional capital of PHP40,000 to buy materials needed for rebonds, relaxers, hot oils, and accessories and Avon products to sell. She believes that this loan will help her to work out her plan and hopes that she will be successful in carrying them out.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for rebonds, relaxers, hot oils, accessories and Avon products to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Heab

texts.en:
Heab, 36, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a khmer noodle and porridge vendor. Her husband is a truck driver, while her son is a firewood carrier.

Heab is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase building materials to improve her home. In the future, she would like to expand her noodle and porridge business, build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and lives in Baga within the municipality of Panaon, a part of Misamis Occidental province. She is married with five children. Gina operates a general store and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for two years and is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more stock for her store. In the future, Gina hopes to send her children to school and help them obtain their college degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and married with three children. She has earned a living raising pigs for the past five years. In addition, she also makes money selling vegetables.

Susan is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fel

texts.en:
Fel is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur:Philippines. Fel operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. He has been doing this for seven years and earns 11,150 PHP a month. 

Fel is requesting a loan for 45,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase additional products to sell. Fel has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, he hopes to see his children complete their education and to earn an increased income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Taboo, Jimenez. Evangeline has a retail business and earns approximately  5,000 PHP a month. 

Evangeline is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stock for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to provide for the needs of her family and have a number of retail businesses nationwide .

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 22 years old, married and has one child.  She lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City.  Elisa has a clothing business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

Elisa is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more clothes to sell. Elisa has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Elisa hopes to have an increase income and see her child complete his education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 75 years old, married, and has eight children. She lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Remedios has a fish selling business and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

Remedios is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. Remedios has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, she hopes to have a fishing boat to earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
As a responsible father, Noel has been cultivating their farm lots by planting onions and other vegetables for sale. His wife is his only partner in managing their farm. Despite the hardships in farming, they tolerate them and pursue the business. They want to earn and save to support the education of their three children. They want the children to earn a degree so that they will find a good job someday. 

In this regard, Noel planned to expand his onion plantation to ensure a high yield. He is asking for an additional capital of PHP35,000 to buy the needed fertilizers and insecticides for the onion production. He believes that his patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy the needed fertilizers and insecticides for onion production.

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain the motorcycles she uses in her business. 

Annaliza has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a sari-sari (convenience) store.

Annaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to maintain the motorcycles she uses in her business.

loans.name: Rum

texts.en:
Rum, 38, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a Khmer noodle vendor, and her husband is a farmer.

Rom is requesting a loan through KREDIT Ltd. of 350 USD to purchase fertilizer, rice seed and potato starts to grow in the dry season. In the future, she would like to buy a secondhand motorbike to carry her Khmer noodles to sell around her village, purchase wood to cover her house’s walls and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seed and potato starts.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, 46, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, while her husband is a palm juice vendor and her son is a chef.

Sim has requested a loan of 700 USD through KREDIT Ltd. to purchase a motorbike to use in a motor taxi business. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income and support her children to study toward a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use in a motor taxi business.

loans.name: Zoriada

texts.en:
Zoriada, 42, is a married woman with six children. She resides in Sumalig in the municipality of Tambulig, a part of Zamboanga del Sur province in the Philippines.

Zoriada has harvested and sold farm-raised fish to her local community for the past six years. Each month she earns 12,000 PHP doing this type of work.

Zoriada has been a member of GDMPC for a year. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to raise. Zoriada’s goal is to save her money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Joyce has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Joyce has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Joyce hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with three children. She is 48 years old and resides in the Philippines. 

Patricia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional stock to sell. 

Patricia has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Patricia wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchased stock to sell in her general store.

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them. Cristina runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, sugar, etc.. 

Christina is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more stock, such as soap and canned goods, to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with three children. She is 48 years old and resides at Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, the Philippines. 

Leonila runs a fishing business, harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. She has been in this business for ten years. Each month she earns PHP 10,000 from her business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional fish to raise and sell in the future. Leonila has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Leonila wants to purchased another pump boat to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise and sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 57 years old and married with seven children.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. 

Elsa has borrowed and reimbursed 18 loans from NWTF prior to this one. She has been running the sari-sari store for 24 years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Elsa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 65 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari store.

Yolanda has been operating her sari-sari store for a year and also earns an income by raising pigs. Previously she has borrowed and paid off four loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Yolanda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 27 years old, unmarried and lives in the Philippines. For the past ten years she has had a shop from which she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Marina became a member of HSPFI this year. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock for her shop.

In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 43 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family by selling charcoal. She has been in the business for the past fifteen years. Additionally, she buys and sells dry goods and wholesale rice.

Previously, Editha has borrowed and paid off 28 loans through NWTF. She is now requesting a 35,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Efrilyn

texts.en:
Efrilyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Efrilyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Efrilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Efrilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. 

Juvy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Juvy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juvy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Joe-An

texts.en: Joe-An is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Joe-An has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & breads. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads. Joe-An has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joe-An hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Teresita has a flower garden from which she harvests and sells flowers, such as orchids. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for her flower garden.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her flower garden.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Delilah has a shop that makes and sells liters of hypo, a cleaning agent. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy ingredients needed for making hypo.

Delilah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delilah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed for making hypo, a cleaning agent.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 51, is widowed and resides with her three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer. Two of her children are employed as garment workers. 

Chantha requests a loan of 800 USD to purchase fertilizer and seed rice to grow in the dry season. In the future, she would like to buy more land to grow rice, build a new house, and support her youngest son to help him reach a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed rice to grow in the dry season.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.
 
Brenda provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy materials needed for giving pedicures and manicures.

Brenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to give pedicures and manicures.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. 

Renato has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Renato has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Renato hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат женщина в возрасте 33 лет, мать двоих детей. Она кредитуется с 2009 года. Её муж работает водителем маршрутного такси, его доход еле хватает на жизнь семьи, поэтому он решил помочь жене в 2002 год открыть свою торговую точку в центре города при входе больницы. У неё постоянно идет торговля, так как посещающие больных покупают у неё нужные товары. У Мухаббат очень разнообразный ассортимент продуктов питания и питьевых напитков и она старается постоянно его пополнять. Она помогает в семейных расходах мужу с полученной прибыли.На полученный кредит она хочет увеличить свой товарооборот под праздники Нового года.
texts.en: Muhabbat is a 33 year-old woman, who is a mother of two children.  She has been obtaining financing since 2009.  Her husband works as a shuttle taxi driver, and his income is barely enough for the family's living expenses.  This is why he decided to help his wife to open her own retail outlet by the hospital entrance in the city center in 2002.  Muhabbat's business is always active because patients coming to the hospital purchase necessary products from her.  She carries a variety of food products and beverages and always tries to add more selections to the assortment.  Muhabbat helps her husband with the family expenses with her obtained profits.  She wants to use this loan to increase her product turnover prior to the New Year's holidays.

loans.use: to increase her product turnover prior to the holidays

loans.name: Theoun

texts.en:
Theoun, 59, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She is a masseuse. Her daughter is employed as a garment worker. Her son is a chef and motor taxi driver.  

Theoun requests a loan of 600 USD to buy a new motorbike for her son to use as a motor taxi. In the future, she would like to expand her business and refurbish her house.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her son to use to provide taxi services.

loans.name: Chyndel

texts.en:
Chyndel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated from her spouse and has four children. 
Chyndel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.
Chyndel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Chyndel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Despite the hardships of life, Jose aims to improve their status of living and give his family a better life. He has been a farmer for almost 30 years, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he plans to expand his onion plantation to increase his yields and income in order to support the education of their two children. 

Jose is requesting a loan of PHP30,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for onion production. He mentioned that this loan will help a lot to expand his plantation and hopes that he will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for onion production.

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 45, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Four of her children are employed: two work as garment workers, and two work as construction workers. 

Ny requests a loan of 500 USD to rent a lake in order to grow lotus. In the future, she would like to expand her business of growing rice and lotus, refurbish her house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to rent a lake in order to grow lotus.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is from the village of Kahayagan West, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 64 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Herminia has been planting and harvesting flowers for sale for over 16 years, earning approximately 6,065 PHP a month.

In 2007, Herminia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

location.town: Kahayagan West, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 58 years old. Ricardo is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Ricardo has been planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Ricardo has been engaged in his business for over 21 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Ricardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ricardo is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Gloria has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Susan has a hardware shop that sells construction materials like gravel and sand. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy sand and gravel to sell.

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sand and gravel to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Rosemarie has a shop that sells used clothing such as t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy a stock of used clothing.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has two children. 

Nita has a shop that sells viands and snacks like homemade sausage. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands and snacks.

Nita has been a member of HSPFI since 2001. In the future, Nita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands and snacks.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has three children. 

Carol has a shop that sells beauty and cosmetic products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy products from Natasha and Avon to sell.

Carol has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Carol hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy products from Natasha and Avon to sell.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. Rey is buying & seling fish, such as sardines & milkfish using his motorcycle. He has had this business for four years. He has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell. Rey has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.  Violita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Violita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Violita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.  Nida has a shop that sells used clothing like shirts, blouses and jeans. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of used clothing.

Nida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing.

loans.name: Gary Zaldy

texts.en:
Gary Zaldy has been engaged in selling dry goods in the public market while his wife works abroad. He is 34 years old and has no children yet. The couple aims to earn and save more income to build their own house and establish a home-based business. In this regard, Gary Zaldy plans to improve his business by selling different kinds of dry goods to meet his customers' demand.

Due to inadequate capital, Gary Zaldy is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional stocks of dry goods such as pants, t-shirts, blouses, jackets, short pants and underwear to sell in the market. He believes that when he works hard for it, he will make his business grow and achieve his goals in the future. Gary Zaldy mentioned that the loan will help him to work out his plan.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.  Ma. Liza has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

Ma. Liza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ma. Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Imelda has a shop that sells food products like adobo, afritada, and barbecued chicken. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of  7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making food.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making food.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is a single lady who owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Mebakari has operated a food stall for the past 10 years. Additionally, she owns a rental house. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase more stock of rice, beans, green grams (mung beans), wheat flour and maize flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, beans, green grams (mung beans), wheat flour and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more desks and chairs for her classrooms.

loans.name: Kuir

texts.en:
Kuir is a 30-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business selling soda and sugar in South Sudan for one year.

Kuir requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soda and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ginger, potatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine keeps a greenhouse. She lives with her husband and two children who help Armine with her agriculture business. Armine has applied for a loan to develop her business. With the help of this loan, Armine will pay for the construction of a new greenhouse. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a new greenhouse.

loans.name: Esnas

texts.en: Esnas is taking another Kiva loan of KES 30,000 to improve her beauty salon business. With the loan she wants to repair a hair-drying machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Esnas dreams of expanding her boutique shop to meet her customers' needs in the future.

loans.use: to repair a hair-drying machine.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Leonora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 40-year-old married woman with no children. 

For the past year she has had a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan. Ayen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase wheat flour and sugar. 

She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Vergie has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy animal feeds for her pigs.

Vergie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Nemia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Nemia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Nemia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mabati (iron sheets) to roof her house.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Normelita has a vegetable garden and sells vegetables like eggplants and ampalaya (bitter melon) during harvest time. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Normelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Normelita has a meat shop that sells pork by the kilogram. She has had this business for 14 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of pork to sell.

Normelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of pork to sell.

loans.name: Blesyl

texts.en:
Blesyl is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.  Blesyl has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Blesyl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Blesyl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Bol

texts.en:
Bol is a 32 year old a married woman with three children. All of them are in school. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Bol requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Fideline

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Fideline is engaged in buying and selling soft drinks and feed in her community. She is 47 years old and married but has no children. Despite this, she and her husband strive hard to earn a living and save for their future. They aim to improve their business and become financially stable. 

Fideline wants to acquire more stock of soft drinks and feed to sell in her community, but due to inadequate capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000. She mentioned that she has some competitors in the area but she believes that she can manage the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks and feed to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosita has a food-shop or "carenderia" that sells special dishes like "adobo", "afritada" & "caldereta". She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making these special dishes.

Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Phoebe has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Phoebe has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Phoebe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. Two of them are currently in school. For the past six years, Frank has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items for resale, and will help Frank to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Frank hopes that in the future he will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Frank who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food items for resale.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 54 years old and is married to Mariano. They are blessed with four children. Her husband is a farmer, planting rice and corn in the Philippines.

Angelita is engaged in a hog raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. Sometimes, she has difficulties in feeding her pigs, that’s why she has decided to request a loan of PHP20,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs. 

She hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family. She will manage her business well and gain higher income. She would like to save some of the income for their future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Maribel has a shop that sells canned goods snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Maribel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Maribel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta lives in Ijevan city. She is 43 years old, separated and has two daughters. Her older daughter is married and lives separately, and the younger one, who is jobless, lives with Julieta.

For several years Julieta worked in the Ijevan carpet company. Since 1995, she has been involved in the clothes-trading business. She sells women and children’s clothes and shoes from a rented stall in Ijevan market. Julieta buys her merchandise three times a month from Yerevan. 

Thanks to her business income Julieta paid for her daughters’ education, organized her older daughter's wedding and provides for her family. Julieta has had four loans from Nor Horizon. Now she is asking for an 800,000 AMD loan to buy winter clothes, outerwear and high boots to sell.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes, outerwear and high boots to sell.

loans.name: Servea

texts.en:
Servea is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. For the past twenty years Servea has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Servea has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. In the future, Servea hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 32-year-old lady who is married to Yefta, a 32-year-old man. They have been blessed with three children namely: Gere, 7, studying at the second grade of Elementary School; Jelita, 4, attending Kindergarten; Gusti, 8 months old. 

Regina runs a kiosk business at her house, and it has been operating for almost two years. Some kinds of daily needs items are displayed at her kiosk, i.e., snacks, instant noodles, coffee, and detergent. Regina is only able to display very limited stock at her kiosk as she only had a little capital. This situation really affects the income that she gets. 

The desire to improve her business and income led Regina to seek a loan but she couldn’t find one until she met one of TLM’s loan officers who introduced her to TLM’s lending program. Regina is interested in joining the lending program and requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She wants to build a small kiosk in front of her house and expand the business stock by adding a greater variety of household needs such as sugar, coffee, tea, wheat flour, cooking ingredients, etc. Regina is hoping to get the loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as sugar, coffee, tea, wheat flour, cooking ingredients, etc. and to build a small kiosk.

loans.name: Byiel

texts.en:
Byiel is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a food stall in South Sudan for the past four years.

Byiel requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase maize flour, soda and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, soda and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Jesusima

texts.en:
Jesusima is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Jesusima has a shop that sells animal feeds by the kilogram and sack. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of animal feeds for sale.

Jesusima has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jesusima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of animal feeds for sale.

loans.name: Nyan Riak

texts.en:
Nyan Riak is a 30-year-old married woman with no children. For the past year, she has had a business selling tea in Bor, South Sudan. 

She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase sugar. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase sugar.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina has been patiently managing her retail store for eight years. She is happily married to an OFW(Overseas Filipino Worker) and they have been blessed with two healthy children. Gina said that the generated-income from her store was utilized in their daily needs: payment for electric bills and allowances for their children. Due to increased household expenses, Gina is aiming to increase her sales and profit to be able to sustain all their daily needs. 

Gina said that having a business is quite difficult due to credit and a lean season she has experienced in her daily routine. Though she suffered from these circumstances, still, she stands firm and believes that she could overcome all these trials in life.

Gina works hard to help her husband in providing income for family. To realize her dream in life, she is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP30,000 which will be use to purchase stock merchandise for her retail store business. She hopes that, through her complete set of merchandise, she could improve and increase her profit. In this way, she can give her two children a good quality education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock merchandise for retail business.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en: Syuzanna is engaged in agriculture, raising cattle and maintaining an orchard. Due to her hard work and enthusiasm Syuzanna has developed her business over the past three years, constructing a barn and expanding the land. Syuzanna needs some financial investment to develop her farming. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase livestock. This increase of livestock will promote agriculture in the community and create opportunities for jobs in the future.

loans.use: to pay for livestock

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.en:
Reymundo is 55 years old and married to Marilou. They are thankful because they were blessed with two children. The family lives in the village of Disimuray. Reymundo is a very responsible father and husband. He is engaged in a business raising hogs, primarily for breeding.

Reymundo is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and vitamins to sustain his hogs. He wishes that someday his business will expand to give his family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to sustain his hogs

loans.name: Awak

texts.en:
Awak is a 30-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She has had a grocery store in Bor, South Sudan for four years.

Awak requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar, salt and onions. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt and onions to sell.

loans.name: Awak

texts.en:
Awak is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. All of them are in school. For five years, she has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan.

Awak requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda and sugar. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase soda and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 52 and lives with her husband, mother-in-law and son in the village of Getahovit in the Tavush region. She also has four married daughters who no longer live in the family home. Anahit’s husband works in construction, her mother-in-law is a pensioner and her son is a student.

Previously Anahit worked at a bakery as a confectioner. Since 2000, however, she has been running her own stall in her house’s yard where she sells food, household goods and clothes. As she has a very large choice of goods, her stall is widely popular, and she has many regular customers. Her business has allowed her to solve her family’s needs, such as paying for her daughters’ education and weddings.

Before the New Year holidays arrive, Anahit wants to increase her shop’s assortment of goods, so she is requesting a 500,000 AMD loan to buy beverages, canned food, candy and various household goods for her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned food, candy and various household goods for her business.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 37 years old and is married with two children. For the past fourteen years she has had a shop from which she sells beverages, canned goods and snacks.

Mylene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

Mylene hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Mae Ann

texts.en:
Mae Ann is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. For the past five years she has had a shop where she sells shorts, towels, shirts and blouses.

Mae Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy more stock for her shop.

Mae Ann hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy shorts, towels, shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik lives with her husband and two children.  She makes a living by raising cattle, but the money is barely enough to cover their expenses. 

Arevik would like to buy more cattle to raise.  This loan will help Arevik make additional income. 

From her profits, Arevik will be able to sustain her household, improve their standard of living and insure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and barn renovation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Lida has an animal shop that sells live adult chickens and roosters. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy animal feed for the chickens.

Lida became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Lida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Loch

texts.en:
Mr. Loch is 60 years old and is a widower who lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. He is a farmer, cultivating rice crops for his livelihood.  He has been in agriculture since 1985 and he has joined a course, successfully studying crop husbandry. He is able to earn an average of $2.00 per day through his business.
