At present he is looking for a loan of $500 from HKL and Kiva to purchase a piece of farmland from his neighbor. He hopes to increase his rice crops and make more income to satisfy his family. He has five children, two of whom depend on his income.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Sosorburam

texts.en:
Sosorburam is 65 years old and lives with her grandson in a ger (Mongolian yurt) on the western side of Mongolia. Her grandson is a kindergarten student and his mother works in the city. 

She started her cart-food business in 2010 by selling to office buildings. Even though she's fairly new to the business she already has many regular customers. She's known for her delicious hot soup. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "When people enjoy my food, it makes me very happy". 

She is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy supplies for her cart-food business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her cart-food business.

loans.name: Rogelen

texts.en:
Rogelen is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rogelen has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rogelen became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Rogelen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Adau

texts.en:
Adau is a 30-year-old married woman with no children. For three years, she has had a business selling food in the hotel in Bor, South Sudan. 

Adau requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Ana has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.
 
Gina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gina became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Suvdaa

texts.en:
Suvdaa is 28 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She started her hairdressing business in 2003 by renting a small space. She took a large number of trainings and expanded her business bit by bit. Now she runs a hair saloon. Her employees and her own hairdressing skills are excellent. 

Now that its holiday season, she needs a lot of supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "My province is a rural area of Mongolia therefore, I need to purchase a large amount of supplies from the city". She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy supplies.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her hair salon.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Leonor has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks like muffins and pancakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy snacks, canned goods and beverages.

Leonor became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Leonor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Jocelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Jocelyn became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rental business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy chairs and for the repair of her videoke unit.  Cheryl has been in this business for two years. Cheryl earns more income from a general store and pig fattening.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy chairs and for the repair of her videoke unit.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo operates and manages his recycling business. He is man who works hard to earn a living. He is 56 years old and married. Rodrigo is glad because he has the potential to lead people.

Rodrigo said that through his bicycle he is able to buy recycled materials and empty bottles, cans, and metal. He would like to buy more but his capital is insufficient. Rodrigo is asking for additional working capital to buy and sell recycled materials. He is asking for 15,000 PHP. He is hoping that through his business, he will be able to improve his family's living conditions and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy  recycled materials, empty cans, bottles and other recycling materials for his buy and sell business

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam, 61, is a diligent farmer who has been working in the agricultural business for many long years. Because she can get enough water from the river, she is able to grow rice crops twice a year both in the rainy and the dry seasons. She works with her husband. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are single. The family lives together in Prey Chor district. 

To strive for better living conditions, Mrs. Sam has requested a loan from HKL to buy a used motorcycle to provide a good means of transport for the whole family. This will mean they can avoid taking any motor-taxi services. Mrs. Sam intends to enlarge her farmland in the coming years if she has adequate capital.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to provide good means of transport for the whole family.

loans.name: Lhagvadulam

texts.en: Lhagvadulam is 26 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, her elder two kids are school students, and the younger one is a kindergarten student. She started her hairdressing business in 2009 by renting a hair salon. Because her hairdressing business can be managed by her husband, she rented a grocery store to increase her family income; however, she does not have quite enough supplies to run it and she needs a vehicle to run her businesses efficiently. She is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to buy freezer, some grocery products and a car.

loans.use: To buy freezer, some grocery products and a car

loans.name: Genny

texts.en:
Genny is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Genny is buying and peddling clothing like towels, shirts and blouses. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Genny has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genny hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Ann Lorraine

texts.en:
Ann Lorraine is married with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ann Lorraine is 32 years old and her 2 children are in school.

Ann Lorraine has a Snacks Vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her business.

Ann Lorraine has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 48 years old and married with 5 children, with 1 child in school. Concepcion works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion runs a Variety Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 

Concepcion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old and married with 5 children. With 3 children in school, Grace works very hard to provide for them all.

Grace runs a Variety Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Letecia is 50 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Letecia has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Tumbuh Kembang 10 Group

texts.en:
Sri is married and a mother of five children. She has been selling Pempek (Indonesian dish made from fish and flour and eaten with soy sauce) on the roadside since 2010. Her business is going well. She can help improve her family's income and help her husband who works as an employee to buy basic daily needs and to pay school fees. She needs a new cart to sell the pempek from so she is taking her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia to buy a new cart. She likes to run this business because she can get income and she can continue the tradition of selling food from South Sumatera, Indonesia. Competitors and more capital are her challenges to expanding her business. Now, as she borrows from VisionFund, she hopes she can expand her business and have enough savings to send her children through university.

Other group members use their part of the loan to improve their business, which include a general store and selling children's snacks.

loans.use: to pay for a new cart to sell Pempek (an Indonesian dish)

loans.name: Ma.wildelina

texts.en:
Ma.Wildelina is 44-years-old and married with three children.

Ma.Wildelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Ma.Wildelina has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Ma.Wildelina aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33-years-old and widowed with two children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 7 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 31-years-old and married with seven children.

Jacqueline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jacqueline has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from shell's crafting.

Jacqueline aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 31-years-old and married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 37-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Maria Theresa has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy clothing to sell.

Maria Theresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Theresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tumbuh Kembang 11 Group

texts.en:
Umi is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to help her martabak stand.  Martabak is an Indonesian snack that can be made fluffy and sweet with eggs and chocolate or savory and crisp with onions. She has been making and selling martabak since 2009.  She is taking this loan to buy more ingredients so she can increase the amount of martabak she makes. These ingredients include items such as eggs, sugar, flour, onions, cheese, and chocolate. She will also by Tupperware because she wants to start selling Tupperware outside of the nearby school to the parents who wait for their children.

Umi is married with three children. Her children are 10, 8 and 4 years old and they all attend school.  Her husband works as a handyman.  Umi likes making martabak and is happy to contribute to the economical well being of her family.  Until now, her business has faced a few challenges including competitors in her area and lack of access to capital.  But now that she is getting a loan, she does not need to worry about a lack of capital to grow the business.

The other group members will use their loans to help grow their businesses, which are selling nasi uduk (Indonesian coconut rice), selling snacks for children, and running a store selling food at a school.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients to make martabak (Indonesian snack) and tupperware to sell

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children. 
Floreta makes and peddles snacks like breads, pancakes, and rice cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.
Floreta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Floreta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Enhnaran

texts.en:
Enhnaran is 47-years-old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in eastern Mongolia. Her husband is a teacher and heir two kids are school students. 

She started her grocery retailing business in 1999 by renting a counter in the market. Over the years she has gained the trust of her suppliers. Therefore, she buys her products fairly cheap price. She uses that advantage to supply other counters. Since her income is the main income in the family, she uses every opportunity to grow. She is lacking 1,200,000 MNT to run her business efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more products to run her business efficiently.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy plantain bananas

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 20-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.
 
Priscilla has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Priscilla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Priscilla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en:
Dioscoro is 44-years-old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. 

Dioscoro has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 1 year. He requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy additional inventory.

Dioscoro has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Dioscoro hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 41-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Myrna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anger

texts.en: Anger, a 26-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in the school, has a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan that she has operated for two years. Anger, who is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and cooking oil, will use the resulting extra income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Maryvel

texts.en:
Maryvel is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Maryvel has a pigpen that sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. Maryvel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maryvel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy soap

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en:
Rosavilla is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Rosavilla has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Rosavilla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosavilla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Judelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.Judelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Judelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Virgincita has a shop that sells snacks, like banana cue & pan cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Virgincita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Virgincita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients fro making snacks

loans.name: Adol

texts.en:
Adol is a 35 year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school.  She has had a business of selling charcoal in Langber Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Adol requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok, 34, has been living together with her husband and three young kinds in a small cottage in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. Sok has spent most her lifetime working in crop husbandry. She grows rice crops twice a year as she gets enough water from a stream that flows through the village. Besides farming, she spends some time walking through the commune to  collect and buy recycled materials from the villagers, and then she sells them to her frequent customers for a profit.

 Presently, she has run out of capital to invest in her business. For this reason, she is asking for some funds from Kiva, through HKL, to keep as capital for her recycled materials business. This loan will make it possible for her to improve her living conditions. She is very happy and thanks all lenders.

loans.use: to use as capital to buy recycled materials for her business.

loans.name: Tuyat

texts.en: Tuyat is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her husband is a chef, and her son is a student. She started her garment retailing business earlier this year. Although she's fairly new to the business, she already has regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that winter is here, she is requesting a loan of 1,150,000 MNT to buy warm garments to sell. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says: "I am finally doing something I love. I can see a bright future in my business, and it is very helpful to my family."

loans.use: to buy warm garments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plantains

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg is 49 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her husband is a cab driver, and her daughter is employed. She started her business journey by renting a gym in 2007. Her gym is big and has professional instructors. There are no other gyms within five blocks of her location; therefore, she has a great opportunity to grow her business. However, her gym's equipment is old and needs some maintenance. 

Enhtsetseg is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to maintain her equipment. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says: "I am losing a lot of customers due to the equipment, and it is difficult to attract new customers. If I fix things up a little bit, I am sure that my business will be successful."

loans.use: to maintain her gym's equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seasoning.

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en: Altanchimeg is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her husband is a herder, her elder kid is in college, and her younger kid is a student. She started her grocery retailing business in 2010 by renting a counter in a market. Her current income is not enough to pay her daughter's college fees. Therefore, Altanchimeg is requesting 366,000 MNT to broaden her range of products. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says: "My younger son will start college next year; therefore I need to act fast in order to be able to support him."

loans.use: to broaden her range of products.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling food in a hotel in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Achol has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soaps for resale

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en: Baljinnyam is a widowed mother of two who lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her elder kid is in college, and her younger one is a student. She started her grocery retailing business in 2004 by renting a counter in a market. Her income was not sufficient to support her children; therefore, she rented another counter. She does not have enough products to fill the entire counter, so she's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy additional supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says: "It has been hard since my husband died. However, I will not look back and feel sorry for myself. I will not give up."

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy three cartloads of firewood

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Рафоат активная и весёлая женщина 49 лет, со средним образованием, замужем и мать двоих детей (дочь и сын). Дочь выдала замуж, но сына ещё не женила. Занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов на рынке. У неё торговая точка на многолюдном месте и её товар не имеет сезонности. В  бизнесе она более 8 лет и ей помогает сын. Он сам работает на металлозаводе, но в выходные дни или в свободное время он развозит овощи и фрукты своим постоянным клиентам из районов. На свои накопления и на наш кредит он купил грузовик. У него есть грузотакси, на котором развозит товар. Рафоат собирается расширить ассортимент и количество товара под новогодний праздник.
texts.en: Rafoat is an active and happy 49 year-old woman, who has a secondary education, is married and is a mother of two children (daughter and son).  She married off her daughter, but not the son just yet.  Rafoat is involved in selling vegetables and fruits at a market.  Her retail outlet is located in a crowded place, and her products are not seasonal in nature.  She has been in this business for eight years, and her son helps her with it.  He works at a metal plant, but delivers fruits and vegetables to their regular customers in the districts during weekends and days off.  He used his savings and our credit to purchase a truck, which he uses to deliver the products.  Rafoat plans to expand her product selection and product quantities prior to the New Year's holiday.

loans.use: to expand her product assortment and increase product quantities prior to the New Year's holiday

loans.name: Osim

texts.ru: Осим кредитор «Арванд-а» с 2006 года, он занимается продажей мужской обуви.  Ему  40 лет. За товаром ездит сам в Бишкек, один раз в месяц. Его жена работает в столовой поваром. У Осима двое детей. Старший сын учится в ПТУ на сварщика, а дочь заканчивает среднюю школу. Он каждый свой кредит использует целенаправленно не расширение бизнеса, следовательно, на следующий кредит хочет привезти партию зимних мужских сапог.
texts.en: Osim has been obtaining financing from "Arvand" since 2006.  He is involved in selling men's shoes.  Osim is 40 years old.  He travels for his merchandise to Bishkek himself once per month.  His wife works as a cook at a cafeteria.  Osim has two children.  His oldest son is studying to be a welder at a professional technical college, and his daughter is finishing a secondary school.  Osim uses each of his loan purposefully for business expansion and wants to use this loan to bring in an inventory of men's winter boots.

loans.use: to bring in an inventory of men's winter boots

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 400 kg of yams

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 37 years old and lives with her son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her son is a college student. She started her garment retailing business in 2006 by renting a counter in a market. Over the years, she has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Her products are known for their designs, quality, and affordable prices. Bolormaa is a sharp and hardworking woman who says: "It is hard to pay my son's college fees with my current income. I have to broaden my range of products in order to pay my son's college fee." She is requesting 2,200,000 MNT to buy supplies of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a broader range of clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Gak

texts.en:
Gak is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Gak has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy one bale of used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy twelve cartloads of oranges

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy pagnes wax (type of colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a responsible and hardworking father. He started managing his rice farm at the age of 21 and continues to manage to provide for his family’s needs. With the desire to lift their lifestyle out of poverty, Alexander and his wife work together in their farming business. They work for their three children who are currently in schooling.  

Because his income is not enough to meet all of the daily needs of his family, Alexander is requesting a loan of PHP25,000 use to purchase farm inputs needed to continue his business such as corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

Hopefully, with their combination strength, Alexander and his wife would be able to support the education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Adau

texts.en:
Adau is a 21-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has worked as a hairdresser in her salon in Bor, South Sudan, for one year.

Adau has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase additional hair products. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional hair products to sell.

loans.name: Reat

texts.en:
Reat lives in the Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is the mother of eight children, six of whom are already married and living in separate houses. Reat grows rice on her farmland, and she typically earns approximately $2.50 per day.

Reat wants to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her two daughters, who work as laborers on a plantation far from their home. This motorcycle will help them to reduce their transportation expenses. Reat hopes that she will be able to expand her farm some day.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben was born in 1962. He lives in Ijevan city with his family, which consists of his mother, his wife and his three children. Ruben’s mother is a retiree, his wife is a teacher in Ijevan School, his daughters are pupils, and his son attends kindergarten.  
 
In 1986 Ruben graduated from Yerevan State Medical Institute, where he specialized as a therapeutist. He has been working in his specialty till now and simultaneously he has been engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation. He is raising two cows, three calves, some poultry and four bee colonies as well. Also he has a vegetable garden and an orchard. Most of the agricultural produce is used for Ruben's family's needs, but he sells the remainder on-site. With income from his agricultural occupation, Ruben covers part of his family’s needs. 

Ruben is seeking a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy one more cow and to increase number of his bee colonies.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and to increase the number of his bee colonies.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё 40-летняя замужняя женщина со средним образованием. Занимается предпринимательской деятельностью почти 20 лет. Основной источник дохода в семье это ее бизнес, т.к.муж Ахрорчон уехал на заработки и его доходы не стабильны. Она продает продукты питания в центре района и ей помогает младший сын. Кредитуясь с 2009 года в нашей организации и работая столько лет на рынке вместе с семьей она постепенно расширила свой оборот,построила дом, выдала замуж дочь и  улучшает условия жизни. На очередной кредит намерена тоже увеличить свой товарооборот.
texts.en: Muhayo is a 40 year-old married woman, who has a secondary education.  She has been involved in entrepreneurial business for almost 20 years.  Her business is the primary source of income for her family because her husband, Ahrorchon, left for work, and his income is not stable.  Muhayo sells food products in the district center, and her youngest son helps her.  Having been obtaining financing from our organization since 2009 and working many years at the market with her family, Muhayo gradually increased her turnover, built a house, married off her daughter and improved living conditions.  She intends to use this loan to also increase her product turnover.

loans.use: to increase product turnover

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 30-year-old married woman with four children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling food in a little restaurant in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Martha requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Geser

texts.en:
Mr. Geser, 52, is a taxi driver around the Kherlen, a western boundary town of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his three kids in the boundary side of the city. He has been running his business since 2005 and his earnings are not enough to provide for his family and cover their expenses. 

His family owns an old house which was built in early 1990. Since it was built, no repairs or renovations have been made to it generally. Lately his house has became very old and damaged all over. Especially, all the windows have broken over the last several years. Therefore it loses the heat to outside through the windows. Due to this, his home becomes very cold during the wintertime.  

Geser is taking a loan to purchase new windows to replace the old ones in his house.

loans.use: To purchase new windows to replace the old ones in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhbayar, 32, is a taxi driver. She has been running her business since 2008 around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has already gained enough experience to do her business in the future. She lives with her two sons and her husband in her brother’s house. 

She recently started a new business, a textiles shop, with her sister in a rental apartment. The preparation is going well, but some sewing tools and raw materials are needed to start her job completely. She needed exactly MNT 3,970,000 to purchase them. Therefore Enkhbayar is taking a loan to purchase some textile materials and a sewing machine, and other tools to start her new business.

loans.use: To purchase some textile materials and a sewing machine and other tools to start her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Amour

texts.en:
Amour is a 28-year-old a married woman with no children. She's had a business of selling clothes in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Amour requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg, 52, is a hairdresser. She has been doing this business for 6 years and already has her own permanent customers. 

She is divorced and now lives with her daughter /a student of University/ in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Urancimeg wants to renovate her work tools such as her hair machine and other equipment for her barbershop because the tools have become old and have some damage to them. Therefore Uranchimeg is taking a loan to purchase the new hair equipment to renew her work tools.

loans.use: to purchase new hair equipment to renew her work tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Amour

texts.en:
Amour is a married woman with no children. She's had a business of selling food stuff in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Amour requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar and soda. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soda and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy  pagnes.

loans.name: Ganmyagmar

texts.en:
Ganmyagmar, 47, is a butcher in the food market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She has been selling meat for less than a year, and already has permanent customers. 

Her main meat item is lamb, that she gets from suppliers in the countryside.  Now Ganmyagmar want to increase her inventory before this Lunar New Year Day, the respectful Mongolian traditional holiday. 

Because the price of lamb increases during the holiday, her sales should increase for weeks.  Ganmyagmar is taking a loan to purchase a large amount of lamb and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of lamb and to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for making soap.

loans.name: Urantogos

texts.en:
Urantogos, 33, is a teacher.  She has been teaching for seven years, after she graduating from college. 

She lives with her husband and daughters in Kherlen, a boundary town of western Mongolia.  Her husband works as a fireman, but his income is not so good. As well as Urantogos’s monthly salary, they don't have enough money to meet family expenses.  

Urantogos and her husband decided to start a new taxi service business to increase their family income.  Now she needs over MNT 3.500.000 to cover the cost of purchasing a new car to start their taxi business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new car for start taxi business.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 53 years old and lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia.  They live in a rental house. 

Byambasuren runs a small flour mill and produces two types flour.  He has been in business since 2009 and his earnings do not meet his family's needs.

In 2009, Byambasuren bought a small piece of land to build his second flour mill.  And he started to build a house on the land. 

But the house is not built due to have a money luck.  Therefore, he is taking out a loan to purchase building materials to finish his house.  

By the way, Byambasuren and his wife are very hard working and honorable.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to build his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Kadidja

texts.fr:
Kadidja est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée à un tapissier. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 scolarisé. Le premier a 06 ans et le dernier a 03 ans.  
Kadidja travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 2006. Elle vend seule à ses clients à la maison et au marché. Elle n’a pas de difficulté principale.
Kadidja a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut diversifier la marchandise
Dans les prochaines années, Kadidja voudrait agrandir l’activité Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d'assurer les besoins en alimentation et santé de la famille.
texts.en: Kadidja is a 35-year-old woman.  She is married to an upholsterer.  She has two children, but only one goes to school.  The oldest is six years old and the youngest is three.  Kadidja has been reselling cereals since 2006.  She works alone and sells to her customers from her house and at the market.  She has no particular difficulty.  This is the first time Kadidja has requested a loan from WAGES, in order to buy cereals.  She would like to diversify her products.  In the coming years, Kadidja would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family's nutritional and healthcare needs.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 54-years-old. She lives in Vanadzor City with her husband. Anna is an engineer, but because of life circumstances she has started to run a clothes trading business. She has managed her business more than 10 years and her husband helps her in this occupation and consequently the business is the only source of income for Anna’s family.

Anna bought clothes from a neighboring country and also from a Yerevan wholesale market. She resells blouses, jeans, jackets, coats, etc. 

This is Anna’s second loan from Nor Horizon and she is asking for a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy winter sweaters and outerwear for her business.

loans.use: to buy winter sweaters and outerwear for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials for shoe-making.

loans.name: Abina

texts.fr:
Abina est une femme  âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est veuve et a 02 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé à 20ans et le dernier 14.  
Abina travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes et basins depuis 2005. Elle vend de façon ambulante à ses clients et achète à Lomé. 
Abina a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et basins. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Abina voudrait prospérer. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Abina is a 36-year old woman. She is a widow with two children, both of whom study. The older is 20 years old, and the younger 14. Since 2005, Abina sells traditional fabrics: colorful "pagnes" and wax cloth known as "bazins." She sells as a street vendor, stocking up in Lome. Abina has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy traditional fabric of the "pagnes" and "bazins" type. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the years to come, Abina would like  her business to flourish. She says that  her revenues will help her family thrive.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Pour acheter des tissus

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is a 48 years old father of three sons and two daughters.  He is an employee with a decent salary and also works in agriculture to increase his income to improve his family's living conditions. 

Hussien has a piece of land and wants to plant olives and almonds seedlings, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN to purchase these seedlings. 

This will give him more crops in the future to sell and will increase his income to create a better family life.

loans.use: to plant olives and almonds seedlings.

loans.name: Fatoumatou

texts.fr:
Fatoumatou est une femme  âgé(e) de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un imame et a un enfant de 03ans qui ne fréquente pas.
Fatoumatou travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2002. Elle vend dans une boutique après s’étre approvisionner à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Fatoumatou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Fatoumatou voudrait rendre l’activité plus productive et durable. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Fatoumatou is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to an imam and has a 3-year-old child who does not attend school. Fatoumatou has been working as a retailer of grocery items since 2002. She makes her sales in a shop after getting her supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Her main difficulty is the drop in sales. 

Fatoumatou has requested her first loan from WAGES to buying more merchandise. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

For the next few years, she would like to make her business more productive and sustainable. She want to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. В этой области она 17 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения подарков, скатертей, посуды и канцелярских товаров.
texts.en: Zebiniso  has a retail business. She keeps a general store. She has been in this field for 17 years. She is taking out a loan to buy gift items, tableclothes, dishes and stationery.

loans.use: to buy gift items, tableclothes, dishes and stationery.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира женщина 37 лет, мать четверых детей. Она кредитуется с 2005 года. Её муж работает строителем. Шоира хочет увеличить свой товарооборот завозом зимней детской одеждой. Её торговая точка расположена в центре вещевого рынка и у нее много постоянных покупателей. За товаром она ездит в Истаравшан один раз в месяц. Она искренне благодарна организации за своевременное финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en: Shoira is a 37 year-old woman and a mother of four children.  She has been obtaining financing since 2005.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Shoira wants to increase her goods turnover by bringing in children's winter clothing.  Her retail outlet is located in the center of the clothing market, and she has many regular customers.  She travels to Istaravshan for merchandise once per month.  Shoira is genuinely grateful to the organization for the timely financing and support.

loans.use: to bring in children's winter clothing and increase goods turnover

loans.name: Kalimatou

texts.fr:
Kalimatou est une femme  âgé(e) de 25 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur de titans et n’a pas d’enfant.
Kalimatou travaille comme revendeuse de produits de mercerie et d’alimentation générale  depuis 2009 Elle vend seule à ses clients dans une boutique et n’ a pas de difficulté principale.
Kalimatou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de mercerie et d’alimentation générale. Elle veut investir dans son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kalimatou voudrait l’accroitre  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer l’avenir de ses progénitures.
texts.en:
Kalimatou is a 25 year old woman.  She is married to a semi-truck driver and has no children. Kalimatou has been working as a food and dry goods retailer since 2009. 

She makes sales to her clients by herself from a shop, and has no significant hardships.  Kalimatou has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase dry goods and general food stock.  

She wants to invest in her business, which, in the coming years, Kalimatou would like to expand.  She says that with the profits, she will ultimately be able to provide a future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of general food items and dry goods.

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhtsetseg, 24, sells shoes in the market in Darkhan, the second-largest city in Mongolia. She has been running her business for half a year and already has some permanent customers. She has lived with her husband and her two children in a rental house since she got married. Her business earnings do not always meet the needs of her family; therefore, she decided to expand her sales volume to increase earnings. It is very important for a new family such as hers. The loan she is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing large numbers of shoes from her supplier, to increase her commodities.

loans.use: To purchase a large number of shoes from her supplier to increase her commodities.

loans.name: Baatartungalag

texts.en:
Enkhtsetseg, 24, sells shoes in the market in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia.  She has been in business for less than a year and already has permanent customers. 

She lives with her husband and two children in a rental house, since they are married.  

Her business earnings do not meet the family's financial needs.  Therefore she decided to expand her sales volume to increase her earnings.

The loan she is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing a large numbers of shoes from her supplier.

loans.use: to purchase a large numbers of shoes from her supplier.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes [for resale]

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Florence is a forty-seven-year-old widow with three kids. The kids are currently in school. She lives in her own house with her family in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region.

She sells kenkey (a local meal made with cooked maize dough and it’s enjoyed with fried fish), a business through which she makes a source of revenue.  For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to purchase enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. 

With the loan, she wants to expand her business by buying more sacks of maize. She believes the loan will enable her to save more income to support her kids in school since she wants all her kids to go to the University. She is member of the group called “Osom Pa” which means good service Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 37 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 08 ans et le dernier a 02 ans.  
Koffi travaille comme revendeur de tôles ondulés depuis 2007. Il vend à toutes personnes dans une boutique. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Koffi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tôles ondulés. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité de tôles 
Dans les prochaines années, Koffi voudrait rendre l’activité durable et productive. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Kofi is a 37-year old man. His wife works as a vendor. He has two children, one of whom is in school. The older child is eight years old, and the younger is two. Koffi has been selling corrugated sheet metal since 2007. He sells to the public at large in a store. His main challenge is a slump in sales. Koffi has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy corrugaged sheet metal. He would like to reinvest in his business. In the future, Koffi would like to make his business stable and profitable. He says that his revenues will help keeping his family happy.

loans.use: to buy corrugaged sheet metal

loans.name: Alisahab

texts.en: Alisahab's business is preparing products from iron. He is 56 years old and lives with his family. In the future, he plans to open another production shop to expand his business. He wants to obtain this loan to make repairs at home. Because of the bad condition of his house, it is cold in the winter. He hopes you will help him with his needs.

loans.use: to repair his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy oranges.

loans.name: Aysara

texts.ru: Айсара проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Айсара занимается торговлей детской одежды и женской обуви. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Aysara lives in the Pyandj region. She is 52 years old, married, and has two children. Aysara sells children's clothing and women's footwear. She has been engaged in this activity for 12 years. She is taking the loan to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: To buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Chuluunsuren

texts.en:
Chuluunsuren, 41, is a teacher.  She has been teaching for 7 years since she graduated from college.

She lives with her husband and daughters in Kherlen, a boundary town in western Mongolia. 

Her husband works as a fireman, but his income is not so good.  Chuluunsuren’s monthly salary does not meet her family's expenses. 

Chuluunsuren and her husband decided to start a new taxi business to increase their family's income. 

Now she needs over MNT 1.600.000 to cover the cost of purchasing a new car to start the taxi business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new car to start the taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny is a 40-year-old married farmer in his village. Since he was blessed with two school-aged children, he needs to double his industriousness in farming to earn enough funds for his family. He leaves early in the morning to monitor his business. This work is not easy but satisfying especially if it results in abundant crops. To gain abundant crops, he is requesting a loan amount of P16,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for maintenance.

Manny is motivated by his desire to offer his family a better quality of life. Hopefully, he will have abundant crops to invest in the education of his children and lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy oranges.

loans.name: Vrezh

texts.en:
Vrezh lives in Pambak village, Lori region. He is 43 years old. Vrezh is married. He has two children who are students in Vanadzor teachers' training institute. Vrezh’s wife is jobless. 

Vrezh has been engaged in cattle breeding for a long time. Vrezh gets part of the fodder for his farm animals from his own plot of land. Any extra fodder is purchased from fellow villagers. Vrezh and his wife produce cheese, butter and meat for sale. Thes products support their family and pay for their children’s education.
 
Vrezh needs a 500.000 AMD loan to buy fodder for winter.

loans.use: to buy extra fodder for winter.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito is married and is a responsible father of two children. He is involved in farming where he lives his family. He grows corns for sale and wishes to yield many crops for the next harvesting season. For him to achieve his goal, he is requesting a loan amount of P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. He hopes that through this loan amount he can grow his desired crops. By this means, he hopes to then save for the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Turwanyubukene/ Kmg Group

texts.fr:
Philémon fait partie du groupe Turwanyubukene/Kmg. Il a 35 ans et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 2 à 14 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.

Philémon est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Philémon voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Philémon is a member of Turwanyubukene/Kmg Group. He's 35 years old, married, and has seven children, age 2 to 14. Out of them, four attend school. His own level of education amounts to eight years of elementary school.

Philémon is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to expand his rice cultivation area. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be the rice provider in his region.

With his profits, he intends to educate his children and send them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a 43 year old married woman with six children between the ages of 3 and 16 years of age. Three of the children are in school. Rebeca has a business of selling food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two year.

Rebeca has requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase beans and cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Twisungane Zone 3 Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel   fait partie du groupe Twisungane Zone 3. Il a 55 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 7 à 20 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Emmanuel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Emmanuel, age 55, is a member of Twisungane Zone 3 Group. He's married and has six children, age 7 to 20. Out of them, six attend school. His own level of education amounts to six years of elementary school.

Emmanuel is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to expand his rice cultivation area. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be the rice provider in his region.

He intends to user his profits to educate his children and send them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a 40 year old a married woman who has six children. Three of the children are in school. She has a business of selling in a grocery store in bor south Sudan for one year.

Rebeca requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase bean, sorghum, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sorghum and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe/kndbw Group

texts.fr:
Léonard fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe. Il a 42 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 3 à 15 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Léonard est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Léonard voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Léonard, age 42, is a member of Abishyizehamwe Group. He's married and has six children, age 3 to 15. Out of them, five attend school. His own level of education amounts to six years of elementary school.

Léonard is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to expand his rice cultivation area. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be the rice provider in his region.

He intends to user his profits to educate his children and send them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Twitezimbere Bahinzi /kzr Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere/Kzr. Il a 35 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 8 à 12 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Emmanuel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Emmanuel, age 35, is a member of Twitezimbere/Kzr Group. He's married and has three children, age 8 to 12. Out of them, two attend school. His own level of education amounts to five years of elementary school.

Emmanuel is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to expand his rice cultivation area. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be the rice provider in his region.

He intends to user his profits to educate his children and send them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Tity B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of one of the primary schools in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. Their school was set up to promote girl-child education in the district. The school is staffed with nineteen employees and has an enrollment of 750 pupils.
 
The staff of this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT (a partner of Kiva.org) to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish with their mere salaries. Some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, land or house-building materials; others invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Thirty-nine-year-old Tity is the leader of this group of teachers.  She was born in Makeni. Tity is a widow. Her one child is attending primary school. She has served in the teaching profession for five years now. She has requested this loan in order to invest in her business. She has been doing business for four years now. With this loan she is going to buy women’s clothes, weavons, and sandals to sell.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothes, weavons, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you Fatu. Fatu is a small scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 4,000,000.00 in order to invest in her businesses. 

Fatu sells cloths – “gara lappers” (locally dyed cloths) and “Bamakos” (cloths made in Mali). She also sells household items like dishes, plastic bowls, etc. She has been doing business for twenty years now. Born in Makeni city, the forty-seven-year-old wife and mother of three children has applied for this loan in order to buy gara lapper making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, etc. in order to produce a large quantities of gara cloths for sale. She will also use part of the loan to buy a bale of Bamako cloths, dozens of dishes and plastic bowls to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy ink, caustic soda, powder, etc. She will also buy a bale of Bamako cloths, dozens of dishes and plastic bowls to add to her business.

loans.name: Adhieu

texts.en:
Adhieu is a 42-year-old married woman with no children. She has been selling food in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Adhieu has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase biscuits, onions, and rice to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, onions, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has been running a food stall in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Yar has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, rice, and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Zeneida Yaned

texts.es: La señora Zeneida a sus 40 años de edad es madre de dos hijos y propietaria de una pequeña tienda de productos de la canasta familiar y adicionalmente tiene una producción de comidas rápidas y típicas de la región, la tienda le permite a la señora Zeneida generar los ingresos para el sustento de su familia. La señora Zeneida requiere de la compra de surtido tal como aceite, arroz, gaseosas, productos de aseo personal y snacks, asimismo adecuar su tienda con más estanterías para lograr una mejor exhibición de sus productos. Con lo anterior, la señora Zeneida podrá mejorar sus ingresos y con ello aportar más económicamente para el sustento de su hogar. El sueño de la señora Zeneida es tener su tienda muy surtida y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Zenaida, 40, is the mother of two children and the owner of a small grocery store; she also sells traditional, regional fast food snacks.  The store allows Zenaida to generate income to support her family.  She needs to buy stock merchandise like oil, rice, soft-drinks, personal hygiene products and snacks.  She also wants to install more shelving to better display her wares.  With all this, Zenaida will be able to improve her income and provide more to her home’s economy and support.  Zenaida’s dream is to have a very well stocked store and to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and do some improvements to the locale.

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal is from the village of Disveli, East Georgia. He is 44 years old, married, and lives with his family: his wife Pati, 16-year-old daughter, 14-year-old son, and retired mother. Both of the children go to school. Jemal and Pati support the family, earning their living through agriculture. The family has five milk cows. Pati produces cheese and sells it to local dairy retailers. The family also owns 0.75 hectares of land, where they raise maize and haricot beans (green beans) to sell locally. The family's total average monthly income is 500 laris, including Jemal’s mother's monthly pension. 

Jemal has requested a loan so he can hire a tractor to cultivate his land and purchase fertilizer. With proper cultivation and fertilization, he will get a good harvest next year to sell for a good price. Any additional income will be used to cover the family's daily expenses throughout the year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire a tractor for land cultivation.

loans.name: Hirwa Group

texts.fr:
Samson fait partie du groupe Hirwa. Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 1 à 3 ans, dont. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Samson est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Samson voudrait agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Samson is a member of the Hirwa group. He is 28 years old and is married with two children who are one and three years old. His level of education has been six years of primary school.

Samson is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, which he will use to buy fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to select his rice seedlings. In coming years, Samson would like to enlarge the area he uses for ​​rice cultivation. With the profits, he plans to ensure his children's education.

loans.use: buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mario De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Mario a sus 47 años de edad es padre de dos hijos de 21 y 14 años de edad. El señor Mario es un emprendedor quien desea iniciar su propio negocio de producción de pollos y huevos, esta actividad, ya había tenido la oportunidad de realizarla en años anteriores y con esta se dio cuenta de que podía generar el sustento para su hogar. Actualmente, el señor Mario requiere la construcción de la vivienda para sus pollos y comprar estos en diferentes edades para asegurar la producción. Con lo anterior, el señor Mario podrá optimizar los recursos que tiene y los espacios de su casa, asimismo, generar ingresos para el sustento de su hogar, y a futuro seguir brindando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 47, Mario is the father of two children who are 21 and 14 years of age.  He is an entrepreneur who wants to start his own business raising chickens and producing eggs.  Years ago he’d already been in this business and realized he could earn income with it to support his family.  

Currently, Mario needs to build the sheds where the chickens can live and to buy chickens of various ages to insure production.  With the aforementioned, Mario will be able to optimize the resources he has and the space at home as well as generate income to support his household and in the future continue to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicks and set up the chicken coops.

loans.name: Dushyigikirane No 24 A/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Onésphore fait partie du groupe Dushyigikirane 24 A/Rsz. Il a 35 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 4 à 9 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.

Onésphore est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Onésphore voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Onésphore belongs to the Dushyigikirane 24 A/Rsz group.  He is 35 years old and is married with three children, ranging from four to nine years old.  Two children are in school.  He has eight years of elementary school education.  Onésphore grows rice.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer.  His strategy to grow his business is to use selected rice seedlings.  In the coming years, Onésphore would like to be the rice supplier in his region.  With the profits, he plans to raise his children and provide them with schooling.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Umubano Group

texts.fr:
Edouard  fait partie du groupe Umubano. Il a 40 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 5 à 17 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 7 ans de primaire.

Edouard est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la race améliore du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Edouard voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Edward is member of the Umubano group. He is 40 years old and is married with six children whose ages range from 5 to 17, including four who attend school. His own level of education has been seven years of primary school.

Edward is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, which he will use to buy fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to use improved strains of rice. In coming years, Edward wants to become the supplier of rice for the region. With the profits, he plans to ensure his children's education.

loans.use: buy fertilizers

loans.name: Rachiel

texts.en:
Rachiel is a 50-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 10 and 22, one of whom is in school. She has been selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan, for six years.

Rachiel has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a farmer from the village Disveli, East Georgia. She is 46 years old, married and lives with her husband, Tariel, and 3 children (24 and 23 year old daughters and a 22 year old son). Tariel works as a fireman in the district. He gets a monthly salary. 

Liana is leading the agricultural farm for the family. In particular, the family owns a small dairy farm with 3 cows. Liana produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy product retailers. Along with the dairy farm, the family owns 3.5 hectares of land where wheat, maize and beans are grown. The family sells harvested products at the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Liana has requested credit for start-up of a trade business with clothes. Liana and her daughters will purchase new clothes in Tbilisi (the capital city of the country), at the wholesale market, and sell them in the village from home. As Liana explained, there is no clothes store in their village or in nearby villages. According to Liana’s estimations, her new business initiative will be profitable. She will use the additional income to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale in the village.

loans.name: Daborah

texts.en:
Daborah is a 35 year old a married woman who has five children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food items in bor, south Sudan for three years.

Daborah requested this loan through BRAC, south Sudan to purchase wheat flour and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, milk and onions to sell.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe/mgnz Group

texts.fr:
Odette  fait partie du groupe Umubano. Elle a 26 ans et elle est mariée avec 3 enfants de 2 à 9 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Odette est cultivatrice de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la race améliore du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Odette voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Odette is a member of the Umubano group. She is 26 years old and married with three children aged between 2 and 9 years old, two of whom are in school. She attended five years of primary school.

Odette is a rice farmer. This is her first loan cycle with ACB, and she will use her credit to buy fertilizers.

Her business growth strategy is to achieve an improved breed of rice. In the coming years, Odette would like to become the local supplier of rice. She will use her profits to support her children’s education and tuition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice farming activity.

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es: La señora Marta a sus 38 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad, es una emprendedora quien desea iniciar su propio taller de producción de vestidos de baño, esta idea surge del deseo de tener su propia empresa puesto que la señora Marta esta por graduarse de diseñadora de modas. La señora Marta cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en este oficio. La señora Marta requiere de la compra de insumos para iniciar su producción de vestidos de baño, lo que le permita poder iniciar su taller y tener satisfacción personal y profesional. El sueño de la señora Marta es tener su propio almacén de venta de vestidos de baño y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marta, 38, is the mother of two children who are 17 and 9 years of age.  She’s an enterprising woman who wants to start her own bathing suit manufacturing workshop.  This idea arose from her wish to have a business of her own since Marta graduated as clothing designer.

Marta has more than five years’ experience in this occupation.  She needs to buy supplies to start bathing suit production so that she can start her shop and attain personal and professional satisfaction.  Marta’s dream is to have her own bathing suit store and to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and patterns.

loans.name: Ajoh

texts.en:
Ajoh is a 42 year old a married woman who has six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in a stall in bor, south Sudan for three years.

Ajoh has requested this loan through BRAC, south Sudan to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El  señor  Simón  es cerrajero, cliente nuevo de la institución, es casado con la señora Sonia  y tiene dos hijos uno esta en edad escolar, vive en la  ciudad de el Alto, el cliente  realiza todo los trabajos con metales, como rejas, ventanas, esta es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia, el crédito lo invertirá en  la compra de materiales de construcción para la refacción de su domicilio y el saldo lo invertirá en la  compra de un taladro y arco para soldar, El Sr. Simón se siente muy feliz por ser beneficiado con el crédito, ya que el Sr. Simón es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Simón is a locksmith.  He’s a new client of the institution.  He’s married to Sonia and has two children one of which is school aged.  He lives in El Alto.  He does all sorts of metalwork: grilles, windows.  This is his only source of income to support his family.

He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to do some home repairs and what’s left over will be used to buy a drill and an arc welder.  Simón feels very happy to be benefitted with a loan because he is a very hardworking person with a strong desire to improve his entire family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to do some home repairs and to buy a drill and an arc welder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Tuzamurane/gknk Group

texts.fr:
Jean Damascène  fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane/Gknk. Il a 31 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 3 mois à 5 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 2 ans de primaire.

Jean Damascène  est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Damascène  voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean Damascène belongs to the Tuzamurane/Gknk group.  He is 31 years old and is married with three children ranging from three months to five years of age.  Two children are in school.  He has two years of elementary school education.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer.  His strategy to grow his business is to develop selected rice seedlings.  In the coming years, Jean Damascène would like to be the rice supplier in his region.  With the profits, he plans to raise his children and provide them with schooling.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Orquidia Marisol

texts.es:
Orquídea, se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina y de frijol, ella es casada, vive con su esposo y no tiene hijos, ella inicio el negocio desde hace un año, junto con su esposo, pero quien le enseño la preparación fue su suegra, trabaja todos los días de la semana de 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo, para la compra de maíz, leña, frijol, aceite y otros productos para la elaboración de los tamales. Esta compra le ayudara para tener todos los materiales necesarios para continuar en su negocio, y obtener a mejores precios los productos que compra.
Ella quiere crecer, mediante los préstamos, apoyar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
